Much to my deep regret I received the news of the death of Bishop Whitehouse of Chicago Illinois, he was a great man and a good Christian. His loss will be deeply felt, far and near. News from home say that Octavius has hurt his spine from too much rowing while at Fruitport. Tonight the wind has changed and a light fog has come up and it rains, it has taken off all the Mosquitoes. Today we had quite an  X  excitement, some men came and walked into our Landlady,s room and took all her Gin Whiskey and wines, it being against the law to sell liquor and he had done it at his own Bar. Tonight David went down with Mr Lufkin to try and fix it, but it being against the law, I think he will have to pay one hundred dollars. This afternoon Dr Hulse lectured to some people who called on Mr Lufkin. It rains so no one can play croquet, we went in the parlour and danced. At noon Mrs Westcott left for Boston. Mrs R.J. Ward of Louisville died some days ago. I had letter from Eva and Ada as well.  Saturday Aug 15, 1874  A little cloudy and cool we are all well. Received a letter from home. After breakfast Siss with David Adele and Mattie Faulds all went to Yarmouth did not return until late in the evening. Received letters from home Virginia is quite sick with Hemorrhage I don't think we will get off Monday. After supper all the girls got up Tableau in the parlour, they were very good. Eva Lufkin was excellent as the Housekeeper.   Sunday Aug 16  A beautiful day, I went out to walk, it was beautiful all of us well. Several people from the Village came to hear Dr Hulse lecture, he talked also in the evening. Many disagreed with him, he thinks the bible is full of errors, and ought to be well searched and studied he believes in a personal God and in Nature,

Monday Aug 17th 1874.  Another beautiful day all well but Virginia she has her old troubles, we were to have left today, but Virginia being sick we talk of tomorrow, but will have to wait and see. this afternoon we go to Yarmouth to purchase some gifts for the servants of the house, which are Mrs Jaime Hoyt, Eva Pratt, Mrs Pratt and Warren Lufkin the names of the boarders who we have formed friendship for are Mrs Abbott, Miss & Mrs Westcott, Miss Lincoln Miss and Mrs Thatcher, Miss Daniel & Mr Staples, Mr Tewskbury, Mr Fullerton we are to have a sheet and Pillow slip party tonight.  Teusday Aug 18th 1874.  I was awakened this morning by the Porter at five, got up and dressed went down into the Dining room, and found eleven ladies there and three or four gentlemen waiting to receive us. Mr Faulds is such a favorite that all got up to see him off to Boston he goes before us, and we will follow at noon. It was too early for his wife to start has she has been sick. Last night all our boarders were dressed in sheet and pillow cases and danced and had a good time of it, they all looked very well. Mr Hall the friend of the Doctors arrived tonight so Dr Hulcee is in extasey, Several people by the name of Whitaker came to day. We leave this pleasant seaside place to day, it has made us all feel stronger and better the Proprietor and wife Mr J. M. Lufkin regret to have us go. At one O.clock we all left Cape Cod Bay House, in the large Omnibus, and Miss Thatcher & brother, Miss Lincoldn, Dr Hall Miss Westcott all went to the Cars with us, they felt very sorry to have us go. David left the Hotel at 6 in the morning eleven ladies and Gentlemen came down to see David go he was a great favourite and the life of the house. We gave the servants all presents of nice dresses last night Dr Hall came Dr Hulce,s friend, which pleased them very much. Mr Chas Tobey called today from Chicago to see me, his brother lives in Denniss, after leaving Yarmouth we pass Barnstable and West Barnstable, East Sandwich and many pretty places. We reached Boston at seven O.clock and went to the St James Hotel had fine rooms, a good supper and went to bed our trip here was very warm.

note top left:  Mrs Badger came home Aug 22 -   Wednesday Aug 19th 1874.  We had a lovely breakfast and the day is beautiful and cool, We all went shopping with Sisters and children, we bought presents for our servants at home, to night we are going to the Hippodrome It was grand, the March of the Nations was very fine, Barnum has certainly made a sucess of this show. There must have been 1500 people present. Boston seems all alive now business brisk, we met Mr Ben Bruce and Mrs McCauly and Mrs McHay on the street, also Mr Campbell who we met at the Cape Cod House. he introduced us to Mr Munson, we took late supper after returning from the Circus. Thursday Aug 20th 1874. We rose at eight took breakfast and all started for a shopping excursion, we returned at one found Mrs Westcott at the Hotel waiting for us. She wanted to see all our party. we took her to dinner with us. at 2, Oclock the Stage came to the door, and we all got in bag and baggage and went to the Depot, in a few minutes we got in the Cars and started for Chicago, on the train we met Mr Gregory and had a chat with him, we travelled along nicely and had our berths made up early and rested very well, had nothing to disturb or annoy us. it was warm in the night. We rose early and got out and took our breakfast at seven on the road, we met Mr Montgomery on the Cars at Rochester, it was here that we changed cars, David Siss and family going to Louisville and me taking Cars for Chicago, Mr Price met me on the Cars and gave me a pass to Detroit, we took our lunch and supper on the Cars, the Hotel car is kept very nice, we spent a very pleasant day. Friday Aug 21st. After David left us we traveled along without trouble it poured rain all our journey, all of us well. Saturday Aug 22nd. We arrived this morning at eight, its still raining the Lake very rough, we met at the Depot Mr Badger Mr Angell my two boys and Eva ran down street to meet us. we found all well and fat my two boys much grown. Nancy and all glad to see us, our house looks very nice it is painted all new on the outside, Eva has her room beautifully fixed up, all trimmed in orange color, anything looks beautiful at home,

[note top left:  Lake Forest X ]]  Sunday Aug 23rd 1874.  Today is cool and lovely. Mr Angell and Eva went to Church, Mr Badger and the boys went to Grandpa Badgers today. All of us well. It seems so good to be at home we have a new girl named Matilda, she is a Mulatto. Belle and Mr Harvey came up from Lake Forest Saturday to see me, they all well. I have not seen Ada yet. Eva looks well and handsome, Hunt is delighted to see his dog Rolla a large black Newfoundland and Jerry his sheep. Our goats are also well and strong. Col Brown called tonight, Mattie & Octave gone to Mrs Hiltons.  Monday Aug 24th 1874.  Today is a most perfect day, all of us well. At ten O,clock Mr Harvey my soninlaw called and gave me his car ticket and said Mattie Faults, Jamie Hunt & myself must all go  X  out to Lake Forest and see his baby, and he sent us a Carriage to take us at eleven to the depot. So we made great haste and got ourselves ready and started for Lake Forest. In about an hour we arrived, and found Belle there to take us to the Hotel with her Carriage. They have lovely rooms for themselves and for their boys, have their carriage and horses and two saddle horses for their boys we had good rooms. Jamie and Hunt occupied one room and Mr Badger and myself the other, and Mattie slept with Ada. The Hotel is very handsome and the grounds are beautiful the Ravines and Woods are something you seldom see here on our plains, We stayed all night, after supper we went into the parlour and sang and danced and played games. We took breakfast and then went driving with Belle. At one o'clock we went to the Cars and started Tuesday for Chicago and got here about two, found Shreve at the Depot on his pony, he said the Carriage could not come down as the wheel was broken, so we returned home in the street Car my daughter Belle and Ada have been at Lake Forest over a month, Ada don't want to come in so soon, but Mr Harvey has to come in on account of his boys going to school. Belle's baby is splendid she is only four months old but is large and fat weighs blank pound. She is the best baby I ever saw, never cries and goes to every one.

Teusday Aug 25  We came in from Lake Forest at two o'clock this morning, found Virginia my Sister well, also Eva Mr Angell and my two boys, all glad to see us back. Eva and Mr Angell gone out to drive, Mr  Gibson T. Kelly called to see us tonight. Octave devoted to Mattie, we are glad to be settled at home once more, we have a new Mulatto girl named Matilda, a black girl Susan Laundress, coloured woman Nancy our Cook, coloured man named William Coachman and Jim my cooks husband.  
Wednesday Aug 26, 1874.  A lovely day, all of us well. At one O.clock Ada and her trunk came from Lake Forest, and Belle and family returned also. At five O.clock Mr Angell came home with a pretty Peacock for Mattie, Eva, Mr Angell and myself to drive, we went out on the Boulevard and found it crowded with people, returned home late and took our tea, Mr Wyley called after tea. Thursday Aug 27, 1874  This is a lovely sunny day, all well. Belle Mr Harvey, Robby, Maggie & baby all came to lunch with us, the baby is very beautiful and good. Mrs Frank Sherman & her daughters Mrs Bill called so did Mrs Hickling, Mrs Fulton, Mrs B B. Bolsford, Mrs Aldrich, Mrs Truey Lay, Miss Boone & Miss blank, Mrs Ralston, Mrs Hill, Mrs Burten & Miss Isaacs, Mr C. Page Bryan all called to see us today. Tonight Mrs William Keep called to see us all, tonight Mr Angell and wife went driving.  Friday Aug 28, 1874.  Today has been sunny and beautiful, all of us well, Belle, Nurse baby and Robby came to see us today. Mrs Snyder & Miss Gouvernan called, so did Miss Honore and Miss Latimer. Eva & Jamie gone out shopping. We had a letter from Mattie Sheridan she arrived safe and is glad to be with her mother Mrs King she has written a piece for the paper and it has been published. Mrs James Miller, who was Miss Fleetwood died today at Marquette, will be buried Sunday.  Saturday Aug 29, 1874.  A little cloudy today with light rain, all well. Mrs Hilton & Mrs Lev. Badger called, also Mrs Kelly, Belle called and took Eva to ride, Dolly Logan here tonight, she goes Monday to Georgetown to school, Eva sent a lovely basket of Flowers to Mrs James Miller who is dead.

note top left:  Belle 31st, Eddie married Sept 3rd  Sunday Aug 30, 1874   note top right:  Mrs Leiter Sept 1st  To day has been blustering but mild. Eva & Mr Angell went to church. At two O.clock I went with Ada, Eva, and Mr Angell to the funeral of Mrs James R. Miller, she died suddenly at Marquette, she leaves one little girl only about 3 years old. She was the daughter of Mr Stanly Fleetwood. After the funeral I came home in Belle's carriage, also Licinia Hilton and carrie. after our tea Mr Badger Sheridan and myself all went to see Belle, found them all well and they have Mr & Mrs Pierce with little Carl to spend some days with them, we stayed all evening, Mrs Nora Cobb Coleman's baby is said to be dying.  Monday Aug 31st 1874.  To day is bright and delightful a lively breeze. all of us well. Lucinda Butler called to get me to take her and her Husband to live with us at our house as Coachman and Laundress. I have not decided about it yet. Belle called and brought her children to spend the day. Eva & Belle gone shopping, so had Mattie & James. Our Phaeton mended and Mr Badger and Shreve gone out in it. Mr Angell and Eva gone to Kenwood to see Katie, she is to be married on Thursday to Mr Horace Lunt. Eva bought many pretty things today for her room, Sheridan gone to the Theatre.  Teusday Sept 1st 1874.  
Mr Leiter and family came home today. Virginia, Ada, and James went shopping today. Mattie and I went with Hunt to Mrs Hilton's to lunch, we enjoyed it very much and went to see Belle at five O.clock, then came home and called to see Mrs Leiter, then went over to see Mrs Gen Logan who is going away tonight with Dolly to school, then went around to see Mrs Cobb, her Grandchild Walter Coleman died last night, of Colera Infantum, and will be buried tomorrow. John Butler called to night to get the place and Coachman.  Wednesday Sept 2nd 1874.  To day has been beautiful and bright, at nine O.clock, I sent Hunt to Mrs Cobb with a White Lily and freshias for the dead baby. At ten O clock I went around to the funeral, found many there, the family very grieved the baby looked beautiful. Belle was there with Robby but he was sick and she brought him to me to see him. Mrs Hilton and Mrs Badger dined today with me. At five O clock Mr Angell took Mr Badger, Eva, & myself to drive. Mr Riley called.

note top left:  tools --vaccinated.    Aunty Lizzie.  Thursday Sept 3rd 1874.   note top right:  Catie married  X   This morning was rough and windy it had rained all night -- at 12 O. clock Mr. Angell go a Carriage and Mattie Eva James Ada Hunt & myself all went to the Cathedral of Bishop Whitehouse to see Miss Catie Isaacs and Mr Horace Lunt get married, the Wedding was a pretty one.  the bride was dressed in a travelling dress of green silk embroidered it was very pretty dress.  The bride was very composed.  Mrs Barton,s dress was very pretty of purple silk, after they went to the Pacific Hotel and changed their dresses for the Cars.  Catie had a brown poplin dress for travelling. they live at Kenwood but took rooms at the Pacific in a parlour bedroom & dining room, they had two O. clock breakfast prepared for them in grand Style at the Hotel, only Mrs. Lunt & Mrs. Bartons, family were at breakfast except Ben Knowles, it was served in grand style,  they go to Evanston after their trip and make it their home. Catie received many pretty gifts. Mrs Bracket Badger of Porthsmouth died to day.  Aunt who raised A C. Badger. a telegram came to night announcing the death of Mrs. Bracket Badger. to night Dr and Mrs Owens called so did Belle & Mr Hunry and Mr and Mrs Peirce, Col Nelson called So did Mr Sam Wheeler Mr Sam Jones. Mr Mc Cauley & MrShay & Mr James, Others.  Friday Sept 4th 1874.  To day it has rained often, Mrs Barter called and brought us some Wedding Cake.  after lunch James and I went to Mandels to buy some bargains, it is raining again to night, so Mr Angel and Wife with all my family are in the parlour singing beautiful pieces.  Saturday Sept 5th 1874.  This has been a bright pretty day, all of us well, it is quite cool  Belle sent her Carriage for me at eight O.clock to come and see the baby vaccinated, she only cried for a moment  +  she is well and fat and a beautiful baby.  very fair  X  I stayed all morning with her and Belle sent me home + in her Carriage.  Dr Small was their Doctor.  Ella Badger and Sophia called to see us.  Eva busy fixing her blue drapery in her room.  Sheridan bought a new Sett of tools for Carpenter work, Belle & Mr Harvey came up in their Buggy this afternoon.  We are making peach jelly.  Mrs Ryerson called

[[note top left:  Dr strikeout Owens baby 2 years 8 month Sept 1874 spent clothes  X  ]]  Sunday Sept 6 1874  note top right:  Crow  X  Exposition  X   To day is very lovely and I went to Church with Ada, Eva and Mr Angell. after Church I went to Belle's and took lunch, and Shreve came and took me home. after supper Belle's Mr Harvey came up and spent the evening with us. Mr Wiley came to see us, so did Mr Leiter and his Josie and Mumie.  Monday Sept 7, 1874.  Again it is  bright and sunny, but very warm. Belle came to see us, and took Ada and Mattie to her house to lunch. Mrs Alex N Fullerton and Miss Hill called today to see us. Mrs Chas Henrotin sent party tickets to Eva and Ada today, after ten Mr  Badger and I went to Mr Leiters to spend the evening. Mr Scanlin gave Shreve a + black Crow as a present, it seems tame and flies on Shreve's shoulder. Eva and I went down shopping at Field and Leiters store today.  Tuesday Sept 8 1874.  This has been a very warm day, all well. Belle and her baby called this morning and we went all day with her shopping saw some beautiful black lace beaded dresses and sacks and basques all beaded all over. Belle bought some short dresses for her baby, she is  X  five months old, and as soon as her wardrobe is finished she will put on short clothes. Tonight was the opening of the Art and picture gallery at the Exposition building. Mr Harvey sent us invitations and Mr Badger, Ada, James & myself all went the collection of painting is one of the best I ever saw, they are certainly well worth a visit. Mr Harvey treated us all to Ice Cream and Soda Water, we reached home at seven O.clock.  Wednesday Sept 9th 1874.  Again it is warm, all of us well. None of us went out today. At five O.clock Ada took a horseback ride on the boulevard and Eva went in search of a dressmaker. after tea Mr and Mrs Leiter called, so did Mr Brittan, Sheridan went to the Exposition.

note top left:  Eva 11  Thursday Sept 10 1874.  note top right:  Baby Church X   Today has been very warm - all of us well. I went to see Mr Harvey at eight in the morning, got him to give Mr Denchar a ten dollar bill to go to Milwaukie to make a class for dancing, he is very poor. Mattie gone down to Belle's house. Ada went in the afternoon to take care of the baby. Belle had a dinner party, the guests were Mrs Pullman, Mrs Waite Mr & Mrs Angell and Mattie Faulds. It was a very fine dinner, served with many courses. I went down after supper and stayed with the baby. At ten O.clock Mr and Mrs Harvey went to a party at Mrs Chas Henrotin on the North side. I had several callers today. Miss Whiton, Mrs Anson Bigelow, Misses Hilton, Miss Matilda Clark & Miss Florence Clark. Mrs Louise Clark Church has a daughter two weeks old  X  Mrs Logan called, & Father Badger spent the day with us.  Friday Sept 11, 1874.  Today has been a little cooler, all of us well, Miss Dunlevy called to invite Mr & Mrs Angell to a party Monday evening. Belle called and took Hunt to the Mill with her.  X  Mr Pullman called to say Good bye. Josie Leiter has chicken Pox.  Saturday Sept 12, 1874.  Today has been again warm, all of us well, Belle, Mr Harvey and baby came up to our house to lunch, they all well. James Ada Sheridan & Ada all went to the exposition Shreve took his Father to drive. Mr Angell, Eva & Hunt went this afternoon to the Exposition. After tea Mr Badger and Shreve went down town, Sent a unclear to Violet Shreve from Mrs TT Shreve. Miss Ida Honore to be married to Col Fred Grant in October.  Sunday Sept 13, 1874.  Today has been beautiful and cool, all of us well no one went to Church. Mattie & Octave went to Father Badgers to dinner, after our lunch Mr Angell Eva Mrs  Badger and myself all got a hack and went to see Catie J. Lunt she returned from her bridal trip, well and happy, then went to the West side to see the Badgers. Then went to see Belle she has cold, all her family well.

note top left:  McHeggan  Monday Sept 14, 1874.  To day has been rainy, all of us well and at home, Eva and Mr Angell gone to night to Miss Dunlevy's party. It has poured rain all day and is still raining hard and it is now 12 O.clock. Mrs Locke sent me a note asking me for money or Salad for the Convention of Ministers,  Teusday Sept 15, 1874.  It poured rain all night. Eva James Mr Angell and Hunt all went to the Exposition to day, all of us well. It has turned quite cold. after Tea Mr Badger and I went to see Belle. John had his tenth birthday party today, and we forgot all about it, so Hunt did not get to it, much to his regret. Mrs Pearson D Smith called so did George Meeker.   Wednesday Sept 16th 1874.  To day has been cold but clear, all of us well. James went shopping with Mr Angell. I went over to see Mrs Leiter, she sick in bed, at five O.clock Mr Angell came up with a handsome Dog Cart and took James Eva and myself to ride, the band of Music played and a great number of people were present. We met Belle and her husband Shreve was on horseback and Mr Badger Sheridan and Hunt were in the Phaeton. Mr Wiley called after tea so did Belle and Mr Harvey. Mr Walk wants Belle to buy his house.  Thursday Sept 17,  To day has been cloudy but no rain, all of us well, this is our reception day. Miss L Sharp called so did Mrs Thos Dent Mrs Meldrum. Virginia & James went shopping at Field & Leiter with Belle, then went to the exposition returned at eleven O clock at night in Mr Harveys Carriage after supper Mrs Sanford Perry and her son Fred called to see us. To day Eva's new dressmaker, Miss McHeggan called and Eva took her to make her new red silk and some other dresses. She also has Helen to help her.  Friday Sept 18 1874  To day has been cool and delightful, I went shopping with Eva Ada & James, then went to Mr Angell's and took lunch. Catie Lunt called to see us. After tea Mr Badger & I went with Mr Angell & Eva to see Jefferson play Rip Van Winkle, Belle and Mr Harvey went there with Charles & John.

note top left:  frost 20 +   Saturday Sept 14, 1874   note top right:  Faulds home X   This has been a lovely day, all well. Mr Faulds arrived from Louisville this morning at eight O.clock. Ada went over to Mrs Leiter to get a table from her to paint for the Fair. She is one of the managers. James Faulds and I went down to Mrs Hobsons to get a new hat for Eva. Belle and Eva went to Mr Walk,s house to look at it with a view to buy, it is a mangificent house that cost him two hundred thousand dollars, on Prairie Avenue. After tea James and Ada went to the Theatre to see Jefferson play Rip Van WInkle  Sunday Sept 20 1874, To day has been a lovely day, all of us well. I went to Church with Mr Angell & Eva. After church Belle came up with her baby and stayed all day. The baby has taken cold coughs, they went home at six, Mr Badger and David gone on the West side.  Monday Sept 21 1874  Another pretty cool day, I think last night we had a little frost, it was the first. Ada Mattie & James gone to the exposition. Florence Hilton called so did Miss Gurnee to say Good bye, she goes to morrow to Europe with her Mother Father and Mr Armour, to remain a year. At six o'clock this afternoon, David Virginia Mattie & James all returned back to their old home in Louisville they have been absent since the first of June. I went to the Depot with them in Belle's Carriage, I stopped to see the baby she still coughs, it seems lovely with my Sisters family. I engaged a new girl to night by the name of Letitia for our Dining Room.
Tuesday Sept 22, 1874.  This has been a lovely day, all of us well. Belle called for us at ten O,clock for us to go to Lieters Opening I took Ada and Hunt with me, Eva and Mrs Angell went down earlier. We met her at the store, there was av large crowd, and everything looked splendid we did not return home until quite dark, we went to the Milliners also. After tea Mr and Mrs Chas Barnes and Mr Wiley called, I gave up my Swede girl to day.

note top left:  Letitia  X  Louisa    Wednesday Sept 23rd 1874.   note top right:  Hack 26 To day has been beautiful, all of us well. I have been busy to day having my little room Carpet taken up and everything fixed in order for Mr Badger as a Library  Eva and Hunt gone down town, Ada and Sheridan went out on Horseback with their own saddle horses. Shreve drove to the Park in our Phaeton with his pony. Mr Angell Eva Mr Badger and myself all went in the Dog Cart. Mr Angell drove. The park was filled with people and they had a band of music. Mr Badger and I went down to Belle's to supper. We had a dispatch from home, they all arrived safe.  Thursday Sept 24th 1874  Another warm and beautiful day, all well. This is a reception day so we have had many calls. Mr McKinley, Mrs Allport & daughter, Mrs Leonard and Miss Adams. Miss Abbie Hamilton & Mrs Mr Kimball Miss Fanny Glover Mrs Chas Wheeler, Mrs Tuttle, Mrs Brown, Mr & Miss Chapin, Mrs Chas Henderson, Miss F. Hilton.  After tea Mr Buckmill, Mrs Philo Otis, Mr Wilbur, Mr Thayer, Mrs Dan Jones.  Friday Sept 25th 1874.  It has rained slightly to day, all well. Eva gone out to Lunch with Mr Angell. At two O.clock Mr Harvey brought Belle & Robby up to see us. Belle said she came for a kiss as it was her birthday she did not stay long. Mrs Leiter called and spent the Afternoon we went to Belle's to dinner and after dinner we went to the exposition to see them unveil the Pope Pius the ninth painted by Healy. The house was well filled. Mr Badger had his Buggy wheel smashed this afternoon while driving by a Cart. Bishop Simpson is a guest of Mr Harveys Ada & Sheridan went also to the Exposition.  Saturday Sept 26 1874  It rained to day very hard, all of us well. I have had X several of my Carpets shook and put down by Wm Armstrong our coloured driver. My new girl named Letitia a coloured X girl came to day. Miss McKeggan is dressmaking for Ada we sent for a Carriage and put our horses & driver in it and we went shopping with Eva Ada & Hunt, we had a good time. George Meeker called after tea.

note top left: Jim X Matilda X   Sunday Sept 27 1874  note top right:  Short clothes X   To day has been beautiful. I went to church with Shreve in the Buggy. Ada Eva and Mr Angell and Sheridan all walked, after church went to see Belle s baby. She put on short clothes to day for the first time, pink boots, white dress and pink sash. She looked very pretty. This afternoon I went to see Mrs Hilton our Jim made a big fuss to day with our sevants. He was drunk, Mr Badger ordered him away. George Walton dined with us.  Monday Sept 28 1874  To day it threatened rain, but did not, all of us well. All of us busy dressmaking. Ada has a great deal of talent for sewing & dress making, also trimming hats she also excels in drawing Painting Singing and Languages. This afternoon Eva & Ada drove down town. Jim Moore left our house to day, trunk and all.  Tuesday Sept 29th 1874.  This has been a lovely day, all well, all of us at home with a dressmaker and assistant making Fall Work. Susan my black girl is going away, she & Nancy my cook has had a row she was the cause of Jim getting so mad, many husband.  Wednesday Sept 30  A beautiful day, all of us well. Ada gone to her new French class at Florence Hiltons. Matilda the Indian girl leaves us to day. William broke Eva's handsome clock and her handsome Cordiva a statue. She sat down and cried for a long time. After tea Mr Angell Eva & Ada went to the Concert of Thomas, which they enjoyed. Ada and Shreve in the Afternoon went out on horseback on the Boulevard.  Thursday Oct 1st 1874.  This has been a lovely, being my reception day I have to stay home. Mrs David Gage called so did Mrs Col Loomis and Mrs Meech. Also Mrs Norcross and Mrs Andrew Brown. Belle came up and spent the day with her baby. Sheridan gone to the exposition, he has holiday. Our Nancy was going to Louisville tonight but was too late for the Cars, so she will go to Morrow. Mrs Brittan and Mr Wiley called to night, to see Eva and Ada.

note top left:  Hamilton   Friday Oct 2nd 1874.   note top right:  Hardman  X  Nancy X   To day has been beautiful, all of us well, and busy with dressmaker Miss McKeggan and Mary  Miss McKeggan finishes her work with me to night. our dog Rolla bit a little Italian boy on the arm to day. + Miss Maria Hamilton married yesterday, also Dora Allen Mr Harvey's motherinlaw by the first wife Mrs Hardman died last night. Belle and Mr harvey called to day. Eva's mocking bird came home to day. Nancy Moore our cook went to Louisville to night for a visit  Eva went to Mr Angells Office, and he gave her a very handsome sett of jewelry. Shreve out with his goats   Saturday Oct 3rd  A bright day, all well, I had a letter from my Father. Ada,s dressmaker came this morning her name is Mrs Sherburn. Ada gone to her French class, Eva gone down town, after dinner Sheridan Shreve Ada & Hunt all went to dancing school at Martines. I gave up my black girl Susan to day after tea Mrs Nearby and Belle came up to see us, they had been to the Funeral of Mrs Hardman his first mother inlaw. Mrs Gen Cheltin called  Sunday Oct 4th 1874.  Another lovely day, all well. I did not go to church, but staid at home with Hunt. Mr Badger gone to his Fathers to say Good bye, after our dinner Mr Freeman of New York called at four O.clock I took a desire to go with Mr Badger to Louisville to see my Parents. had a trunk brought out of the Attic, and put Hunts clothes and mine in and we travelled quickly. Mr Angell and Eva went in our Carriage and my two boys took the Buggy. we stopped at my daughter Belle's and said Good bye and reached the train in good time, and at seven o'clock we left Chicago.  Monday Oct 5, 1874.  All night we travelled safely and reached Louisville at eight in the morning, took the Omnibus and reached my sisters houses in a short time, walked right up in their dining room and found all the family at breakfast. They were much surprised and delighted, eat a hearty breakfast after supper went to the exposition with David & James.

note top left:  Shoes, X   Teusday Oct 6th 1874 - note top right:  (Louisville  To day is cloudy. yesterday was beautiful. Hunt gone riding with Miss Mary Goodloe spent day with us. and her two daughters, they nearly grown. Lillie 13. and Lullu 12. They go to Mrs Knowles, school.  We drove to the House of refuge. and went all through the school rooms and grounds. if looks in fine order, I went to the Exhibition and took Hunt all Mrs Shreve,s children Mrs Shreve James and Mattie Faulds. We stayed until three o clock, saw everything they had side shows which pleased very much. The exhibition is very fine, Mrs Chas Johnson and Mrs Buevn of New York made me a long visit   Wednesday Oct 7th 1874.  To day is cloudy but coo, all of us well.  My sister Virginia is quite unwell. all the rest are doing well.  Mr. Hunt & Lizzie called to see me.  in the afternoon Mr Hunt I called on Mrs L Johnson and Mrs Robert Tyler but did not see them. Mrs Fred Grants cards and Miss Honore arrived to day.  I rode with Miss Delany.  To night we go to the German Opera and saw Stradella.  The music was good  Thursday Oct 8th 1874. This is a bright sunny day all well but Virginia she is a great invalid, after breakfast I called to see Dr Hulcee 105 Jefferson Street. he was out. Miss Sallie Shreve called to see me so did Miss Gordon. I bought a new pair of shoes for Hunt. When we got home Dr Hulcee called and he was glad to see us. We took dinner and at two o. clock we started for the Depot. My sisters, two carriages were at the door. and all went to the Cars with us. My Father came down too. Sister Belle sent boxes of candy to my boys and Grandma sent them money. We said good bye and departed Mattie Faulds and James wanted very much to return with us.  Friday Oct 9th 1874.  We travelled all night delightully. had the drawing room on a Pullman car and had a great deal of attention from Mr Wilson and coloured Charlie Johnson. We reached Chicago at seven o. clock in the morning. Walked from the 22 street Depot up to our house. everything there looks well. found all the family in bed but Sheridan, breakfast was soon ready.

note top left:  Fire Saturday Oct 10th 1874.  note top right:  Steven Oct X   Yesterday was the anniversary of our great fire, the schools all gave holiday.  I went yesterday afternoon to Belle,s + with Hunt and took tea, after tea we all went down in carriage to the Exposition, which was well filled with people. Mises Hunt called to see us.  Mrs Gen Geo Forsyth called to see us to day Catie Lunt called, so did Mrs Dunlop and Miss Dunlop to day Mr Badger, Shreve Ada and Hunt.  Sunday Oct 11 1874.  
To day is beautiful, I went to church with Mr & Mrs Angell, Ada and Hunt, then went to Belles, and stayed a little while wrote a letter home.  Monday Oct 12 1874  To day the weather is beautiful. All of us well. Eva and I have been keeping house all day. Miss Lunt called to say good bye, Miss Myra David called and left her Wedding Cards, after tea Mr & Mrs McGregor Adams called to see us, Mrs Wiley and Mrs Larnurel also called, to night I received a   Teusday Oct 13. 1974  This has been a lovely day, all of us well. Eva Ada and I busy about full work, Ada in afternoon went walking Belle & Licinia Hilton came to see all of us.  Miss Hellner called to get the boys to take music lessons. after tea Mrs Geo Montgomery called.  Wednesday Oct 14, 1874.  all of us well. day beautiful. I engaged today  X  a man by the name of Steven white man to drive our carriage. Miss Chappell and Mary T Chappell called to day.  I spent the afternoon with Belle. at 6 o. clock Mr. Harvey Belle and and myself all went to the cathedral to see Myra Davis marry Mr Davis, all finished off beautifully. We then went over to the House for the reception. which we enjoyed. My boys Shreve and Sheridan went to a party at Mrs Adams.  This is Hunts birthday.

note top left:  Oct 17.  Thursday Oct 15-1874.  note top right:  Williams X   To day has been mild. all of us well. Mrs Sanger called so did Mrs Burton and Mr Chas Page Bryan. he invited us all to his home at Elmhurst to lunch and pick or gather autumn leaves. My new black girl Laura came and engaged herself to me to day. We have given up William our coloured driver. to night  X  Hunt had his little birthday party. and had six little candles on his cake. Ice Cream and Cakes. all the family had to come to it. Mr Edwin Hunt died today. 66 years old. Eva finished her rooms to day.  Friday Oct 16, 1874  This is beautiful weather we are having, all of us well. Hunt out playing. Belle & Mr Harvey called to see us. So did Mrs Lucien Colby. Mrs Henry Wheeler and Mrs B.M. Underwood, Eva finished her pretty room to day. black Matilda called to see me to day. so did black Larson, my new black girl Laura came today. After tea Mrs Biddell called.  Saturday Oct 17, 1874,  Another lovely day, all well. Ada went to her french class when she returned home she took Hunt to dancing school at Mrs Martines. Eva went down town she is having her rooms cleaned by Charly her black boy. Mrs Bradey called. So did Mrs Leiter. Ada fell and hurt her ankle.  Sunday Oct 18 1874  A beautiful day, all well. Mr Angell, Eva & Ada all went in a Carriage to St James church on north side. Mr. Badger and Shreve gone to see Mother Badger. Our new white man named Steven came Saturday.  X  X   to work.  Monday Oct 19. 1874  This is a lovely day. all of us well. Belle came up with baby and stayed all afternoon. they talk of going to New York. Miss Kyle dressmaking for Ada and Lena is doing a little for her. My washer woman Martha came to day. Eva and Mr. Angell took tea with Belle and Mr. Harvey. Gen Grant is taking dinner at Gen Logan's today. Eva bought a beautiful pair of blankets with blue border. Mrs. J. M Wadsworth and Miss Nelly called.

Teusday Oct 20 --1874,  note top right:  Grant X  This has been a lovely day - all well - I went to Middletons laundry to day to see if Ada's dress was done up., After lunch we all commenced dressing for the Wedding, and we ordered our Carriage and Mr Badger Ada and myself all started Mr Angell and Eva went in their Carriage we got there on good time and found a beautiful dressed company, also many acquaintances the President and Mrs Grant were there in state Col Fred Grant the Groom and Miss Ida Honore looked very happy. they were married at three and the reception was at four. Everything was in fine style and flowers beautiful, the gifts were elegant and numerous. My daughters looked handsome, Belle in elegant rose silk Eva in pale green Ada in paris muslin and I in pearl silk. After the wedding Belle and Mr Harvey called to see us. We gave them some tea Mrs Sidnap called so did Mrs Gillette Mich Ave. After tea Mr WIley came in,  Wednesday Oct 21, 1874  Another lovely day, all well, we busy getting Ada ready for Louisville, at noon Gen Murray call and Mrs Hull of Louisville, Catie Isaacs Lunt came to see us.. after tea Mrs Chandler called. Mrs S.B Jenkins and her sister Mrs Fred Ray and her Mother Mrs Hilyer all called  after tea Mr Badger and myself, Mr & Mrs Angell, Ada, & Shreve all went to the English Opera of DonGiovanni, Miss Kellogg Prima donna.  Thursday Oct 22nd 1874  To day has been beautiful, all well. all busy getting ready for Louisville sent for Miss Kyle and Miss blank, and had Lena sewing also. Mrs Shaw Mrs Holmes and Mrs Lucius Sherman, also Mrs Gillette, at eight o'clock Mr Angell Eva & Ada all took the train from 22nd Street for Louisville all of us went to the Car, so did Belle & Mr Harvey. Rob here too.

Friday Oct 23rd 1874.  A bright mild day, all well, we miss our family who went last night to Louisville, Belle sent her Carriage for me to come and spend the day with her but I could not go. Mr Carney came and finished varnishing our door. My black girl Laura Miller got mad to day with Sheridan, and I told her to go home and she did. Sheridan has gone to Dr Allport's to have his teeth fixed. After lunch I went down town with Belle and did some shopping for hats. Mrs James L Norton called so did Mrs W.H Nixon, and Mrs Newton Lull. Mrs R E. Tyler Miss Gronerman  Saturday Oct 24, 1874.  This has been a lovely day, all of us well. Sheridan and Shreve gone out to pay some bills for me. I went to dancing school with Hunt, Sheridan, and Shreve and then called with Hunt on Mrs Leiter. At one o'clock at night Mr Badger took Hunt up to see the shadow on the moon, X  Sunday Oct 25, 1874  This has been a lovely day, all well, Hunt has some cold, none of us went to church. in the afternoon Belle and Mr Harvey came up to see us. Sheridan and Shreve went out in the Buggy to see Grandma Badger. Hunts little bird died to day, it was a brown bird that William caught, I don't think its food agreed with it.  Monday Oct 26th 1874.  I rained this morning, but has cleared off and the sun is shining and it is quite warm. all well but Hunt he spent a bad night and this morning had a bad cough, had a dispatch from Mr Angell, he says they are enjoying themselves so much that they will not leave before Tuesday night. Sheridan and Shreve after school went down town to buy some clothes.  Teusday Oct 27. 1874.  This has been a cloudy day, but at three O.clock the sun came out, all well but Hunt he has a severe cough. Nancy arrived from Louisville to day, all well, she is our old black cook. We expect Eva & Ada with Mr Angell in the morning.

note top left:  Carriage 31st X  Wednesday Oct 28th 1874,  note top right:  Snowed,   The weather is quite warm. all well but Hunt has cold and cough still very troublesome. at seven o. clock in the morning Mr. Angell, Eva and Ada all arrived from Louisville in good spirits and quite well. they had a good time while they were gone. Mrs Leiter came over to see Ada take her singing lesson with Prof Bergstrum, they left all the Louisville people well. a coloured girl named Flora washed for me to day, Ada had many friends in Louisville  Thursday Oct 29th 1874.  To day has been cloudy and rainy. Mrs Leiter sent her three children over to show me their new green velvet cloaks and hoods.  all of us well Hunt better. Mrs Eddy called to get me to assist in the Fair for the Homeopathic Hospital  Mrs T .U. Burton called, she has taken rooms at he Pacific Hotel. Mrs C.J. Bryan called after tea Mrs Allport called so did Mr.& Mrs Harvey.   Friday Oct 30th 1874,  To day has been cloudy with occasional snow. Mrs A Jackson and Miss McDougall called Mr and Mrs Angell and Mr Chas Angell came up to dine to day. After tea Mr H H Honore and Mr Franklin Morgan called all of us well, but Hunt his cold is still bad.  Saturday Oct 31 1874,  To day has been quite cold, all of us well but Hunt, his cold is still bad.  Eva and Shreve went out in the buggy to try and get some aid for the Hansons sufferers.  Mr Badger went out to Riverside and also to Glenwood. I went with Sheridan to Dr Allports to have his teeth finished plugging. I called on Belle and found her out. Ada's french class met here to day. Our Carriage came home today from the shop where it has been painting  Belle and her baby came up and spent afternoon it X Snowed today.  Sunday Nov 1st 1874  All of us well, Eva Ada and Mr Angell gone to church. Mr Badger and Shreve gone out to his Fathers.  Mr Britton called for Ada to go to church. It has been a pretty fresh day.

note top left:  Pants,  Monday Nov 2nd 1874  note top right:  X Shoes,   This has been a lovely day, just warm enough. all of us well, our Carriage has come home all painted new. We all went out to see it. Hunt is out again better of his cold. Miss Mamie Boone left her wedding card. Eva and Ada have commenced to go to market for me. Sheridan & Shreve gone down town with the large horses, they are horseback. Sheridan bought new shoes. Miss Kimball Prarie avenue called, after tea Mr. Angell Eva and Ada all went to the Theatre to see Lady of Lyons. Mr. Henry Field and Mrs W Keep called.  Teusday Nov 3rd 1874  All of us well. Hunt went walking with his Sisters to day. Mr Badger gone town town in the Buggy. Mr. Badger gone to vote, so has Mr Angell, Mrs Wahl & Mrs Lenea Kimbark called,  Wednesday Nov 4th 1874.  This has been a pretty day, but cool. all of us well. Belle sent her baby up with Maggie and Robby to spend the day. and she called for them later. Mrs. Logan called to day she is going to Washington to morrow, Ada and Eva gone out driving. Sheridan bought a new pair of pants  +  Thursday Nov 5th 1874.  This has been a lovely day. all well Hunt out playing. Mr. Badger gone out in the Buggy. Mrs Markley called so did Mrs Carlos Cook & Mary.  Mrs J Howland Thompson Miss F Parsons Miss Rumsey and Miss Clarkson.  Ada and Mr. Badger gone to Mrs Wm Doggetts to a party. Eva had a cold and did not go, Mrs Clarence Burley called on Mrs Angell  Friday Nov 6th 1874.  Another lovely day all well.after breakfast I ordered the buggy for Eva Ada & Hunt, they went to the West side to inquire about a girl named Mary Aspel who is coming to serve for me. Mrs Capt Thomasson called so did Miss Heigh, Mrs Noyes  after lunch Ada took my saddle horse and went riding with George Meeker. Mr Badger went out in the buggy with the pony and I went out in our Carriage that is just new lined and painted, our horses look beautiful.  I went to see Belle and to Field and Leiters. Eva and Mr Angell went in Buggy to Evanston to see Mrs H.G. Lunt. They got home at eight o. clock.

note top left:  Grandpa returned X   Saturday Nov 7th 1874.  This has been a very lovely warm day we had no Steam in our house. all of us well. Eva and Hunt gone to market. Ada gone to her French class. Then to Belle,s to dinner. Sheridan gone to dancing school, bought Sheridan a new pair of Pants. after lunch I went out in the Carriage to Mrs Harvey and Field and Leiter then took dinner at Belle,s house. Mr Badger came down and sat with us. Grandpa Badger returned called on Mrs Pullman  Sunday Nov 8th 1874.  This has been another lovely day. all well.  baby Hunt out playing. Eva and Ada with Mr Angell and Sheridan all went to church. I stayed at home, our coachman Steven blank while fixing his horses ran a splinter in his finger and he fainted when they were pulling it out.  but in a few hours he was better  after dinner Mr Badger Ada Shreve & Hunt all went with me in our Carriage to see Grandpa Badger. he returned from Portsmouth N.H  Monday Nov 9th 1874.  To day has been beautiful and warm. all of us well. Mrs Nickleson my old nurse of Hunts called to see me is now living on State Street 1696. Ellen Scanlan came with her baby to see us. after breakfast Eva, Ada & myself went calling. We made several calls. Mrs Percy Smith called on us. late in the evening we called on Mrs Leiter after tea Mr Angell and Eva called on Mrs Pullman.  Mrs George Otis has a little girl five weeks old her first child.   Teusday Nov 10 1874  We called to day on Mary Persons as the day was so beautiful, went to see Belle, all of us well. Sheridan has been home two days with cold in his eyes. Miss Phillips called on Ada.  Wednesday Nov 11th 1874  A beautiful sunny day, a little cold all well, we started out our visiting early. Made many calls. at 2 O,clock we went to Belle B Harvey and took as splendid lunch her her and Bertie. Mrs W. H. Turner with her young daughter called. We went down town late shopping.  returned home late.

Thursday Nov 12th 1874.  note top right:  Snowed  Today has been cold and cloudy, and at noon it X snowed a little, all of us well. Eva ordered the Carriage and went out and made some purchases for our lunch at one o, clock. Mrs Hilton, Alice and Ella Badger came to lunch. We had a splendid lunch. Miss Robinson came to sew today for me she two dollars a day. Miss Kyle came and cut and fit the work she four dollars a day. Mrs Staples Miss Staples Mrs Shortull, Mrs G Lord Mrs Insdum and Mrs Stelle Mrs Albert Keep all called to see us.  after Tea Mrs Lily Fairbank called, J. Ward Hunt arrived in the City to day.  Friday Nov 13th 1874.  It has been quite cool to day.  all of us well, we remained at home during the morning and after lunch went shopping.  called a few minutes on Belle.  She and Mr Harvey came in their Buggy to see us.  My dressmaker Miss Robinson is still working at my dress, a black silk.  George Walter Hilton slept all night to night at our house.  Saturday Nov 14, 1874.  This has been a dark day, it snowed a little, then turned into rain, all of us in health.  Belle with her baby, Robbie Charles and George, also Nurse Maggie all spent the day with us.  after they went away, Eve Ada Shreve went out in the Carriage to do some shopping.  when they came home, I went and bought the boys new felt hats, Ada went to French class.  Sunday Nov 15, 1874.  This has been a lovely day, all of us well.  I went to church with Mr Angell Eva, Ada and Sheridan, Mr Badger went out to his Father,s.  after dinner Belle came up with her baby, and staid all evening.  I sent her home in my Carriage.  Eva and Mr Angell rode home with her.  Mr Badger had a few little things left by his Aunt Mrs Brackett Hutchings.  Monday, Nov 16 1874.  This has been a unclear chilly day.  Miss Kyle came to sew for us to day.  She leaves to night for Louisville.  Mrs Sturges was buried to day.  I went on the West Side to See Some Sewing girls, did not like them.  I went to night with Octave to Mrs Hoyne,s party given to yong Mrs Walker, Mrs Badger Ada Belle Mr Harvey all went to hear De Murska  Eva and Mr Angell at home.

note top left:  girl 18 clothes X  Teusday, Nov 17 1874, note top right:  Assembly 20)  This has been a chilly day, but, no rains all of us well. Belle called and took Evie to the Homeopatic Fair, they stayed all day. I went in my Carriage did some shopping and brought Eva home. Ada and I called on Mr Hoyne and Mrs Govenor Walker  after tea Mrs Badger Ada Sheridan and myself also Eva and Mrs Angell all went together to the Fair. Eva & Belle bought several things, a new girl came to me to sew her name is Marie Schufield.  Wednesday Nov 18, 1874, Today has been very cold, all of us well Miss Kyle our dressmaker came to day to fix party dresses for Eva and Ada. My new girl came to work today, her name is Marie Schufield she is to sew and look after Hunt. Ada gone to her French class. This afternoon we all went out driving, after Tea. Mr Badger my boys Sheridan & Shreve & myself all attended the Concert of De Murska. Ada went with Eva and Mrs Angell she sings very grandly and is certainly a great artist. Mrs Pullman called today.  Thursday Nov 19, 1874. I has snowed all day and now it is quite a snowstorm all of us well. Eva and Ada gone out shopping. Mrs Chapman called to see us at 6 O,clock. Eva and Ada went to Miss Jennie Ludington,s wedding had a nice time. I took my two boys to the fair,  There,s new clothes came home today. X   Friday Nov 20 1874  This has been a beautiful day. All of us well. The snow is about 2 inches and a half thick, it has been warm all day and the sun shining brightly. The sleighs are all out and everything is gay and lovely. My boy Hunt is playing out all day in the snow with his sled. Eva gone out in the Carriage shopping. Ada gone to her French class. After supper Eva and Mr Angell went to the De Murska Concert. Mrs Badger Ada and myself all went to the assembly given by the young gentlemen, It was a very pretty party. about one hundred and twenty five people present. All young ladies and young gentlemen. We the only old married people. Ada was quite a Belle.

note top left:  Eva sick X 22   Saturday Nov 21st 1874 This is a beautiful day. all of us well. the sun is shining very bright and, the ground is covered with snow Belle came with her baby and Maggie and stayed awhile with us. Eva Ada Hunt and myself all spent the Afternoon at the Hospital Fair. and took our lunch and made some purchases. Mr Clark from blank called today on Eva. Sheridan sprained his ankle, he fell down the stairs at the dancing hall. Sunday Nov 22, 1874 It has rained all day. the snow is all melted. all of us well, Sheridan's ankle he sprained on Saturday and it hurts him yet. I went to church with Mr Angell Eva Ada and Shreve, after church I took Mrs and Mr Locke home in my Carriage. Eva left church she did not feel well. Stephen my driver will leave in a few days. Monday Nov 23 1874 This has been a good clear day but cold and windy all of us well. Ada gone to take lunch with Florence Hilton, after lunch I went in my Carriage to see Belle with Eva and Hunt. called for Ada and all of us went to the Fair after supper. Eva took many chances on great many things were sold at Auction. Mr Pearson D. Smith called. Teusday Nov 24 1874  This has been a good day. all of us well. it is no so cold after lunch I ordered the carriage and we all went to Field and Leiters to do some shopping. Mr Wiley called to night. Several coachmen have called today to get our place. Wednesday Nov 25, 1874  this has been a pretty day. Eva took Hunt and went out in our carriage to buy some things for me for Thanksgiving dinner tomorrow. all of us well, after lunch Eva rode out again to order ice cream, after ten George Meeker called. Our gas all went down so low the we had to light a Kerosene lamp.

note top left:  Tom x Lena x   Thursday Nov 26, 1874   note top right:  Well 26--   This is a good day but dusty. all of us well. I went to church, Mr & Mrs Harvey went to my church. after church she and her husband and four boys, baby and Nurse. all came to spend the day with us. We had a delightful time. Mrs Davidson from Canada came to see us. Ada has cold and headache. We finished our Thanksgiving dinner With Ice cream, and Cake.  Friday Nov 27 1874. Today it has been snowing all day and now the ground is covered some three or four inches deep. all of us well. Miss Kyle came to dress make for Eva. I went to Belle,s and spent the afternoon. Mr Harvey sent me home in his buggy. Ada went to French class in my Carriage. Mrs Leiter came to invite Ada to spend the evening with her and some gentlemen on Saturday.  Saturday Nov 28 1874  This has been a lovely day for sleighing. it has been so mild. there are many cutters out. Miss Kyle has been dressmaking for Eva today. Eva went downtown and Ada to her French class. My two boys went out sleigh riding. I went down to Belle,s house at four O.clock and stayed with her to receive her company. Ada went to Mrs Leiters to meet some young gentlemen and then came to Belle,s afterwards. Belle had the club called "Ours" meet at her house they number about 70 members. to night it was a musical All of us in good health. Sunday Nov 29 1874,  This is really a lovely day. Snow is on the ground several inches, and embanked on each side of the street, but it is not very cold and there is much sleighing going on. I went to church with my two sons Sheridan and Shreve, after church I took Mrs Murkly and her daughter home from church. all of us well.  Monday Nov 30, 1874  This has been our coldest morning. all of us well. after lunch Eva and Ada drove out. Tom blank came to us to night X to drive  for  Stephen leaves to night. Lena came to live X with Eva today--

note top left:  Tom x  Teusday Dec 1st 1874 note top right:  Louise x   This has been a bright day. the snow is still thick on the ground. all of us in good health.  X Tom our new coachman came today. Eva spent the day with Belle, after lunch I went out with Ada and Hunt, called for Eva and Belle came with us, we went downtown. recieved Wedding Cards of Miss Huntington  Wednesday Dec 2nd 1874.  This has been a mild day. all well. Ada went out in the sleigh with Thomas and Hunt. Snow is melting fast  Catie Isaacs came from Evanston to spend the day with us.  after Lunch I went to the toy shops with Eva Ada and Hunt. We saw many pretty things, came home late. Mrs George Clark and Mrs Eldridge called on us today.  Thursday Dec 3rd 1874.  This has been a mild day all the snow gone. all of us well.  Eva and Ada went to Belle's to take Lunch with several ladies. Mrs Otis and baby, Miss Foote Miss Alexander Mrs Henrotin & Teddie, Miss Martin & Mrs Coft Tomasson & Mrs Horace Lunt.  they had a fine lunch. after tea Mrs Mill Angell and Mr Cox called. Mr George Lunt came and took Ada to the Assembly.  Mr Badger and I went also to the party. I danced with Dr Jones, Mr May, Mr Trower, Mr H.E. Brown, Mr G. Lunt, Mr Hunter, Mr Kelly, Mr Rockwell, Mr Riley called tonight Friday Dec 4th 1874 It has been cold today and cloudy. all of us well. Belle called to see us. Ada went with her to lunch. I went out after dinner in the carriage with Eva  Ada and Hunt. George Meeker called to night. Mrs Evelyn Bruinard called today.  I gave Louisa up today, so as to get a white girl in her place.  Saturday Dec 5 1874,  A mild day. My two boys went in the buggy to pay some bills for me They broke the spring of the buggy. all of us well. Louisa left today. I had to give her X up. so us to get her room for my white girls. She was very sorry to go and cried a great deal. My boys went to dancing school. after ten Mrs Angell Eva and Ada Mr Badger and I all went to hear Charlotte Chushman read

Sunday Dec 6th 1874  This is a bright day. Eva Mr Angell and my two boys all went to church. After church 2 went to Belle,s and spent the day. Mr Badger and Shreve came for me.  Monday Dec 7th 1874   It has been cold today. I went out driving to look for a second girl, Eva and Ada went out with Belle on a frolic. Mr. David Rutter called, after her Mrs Bryan Lathrop called. Mrs G. H Wheeler sent us party tickets, so did Mrs Henry Hill.  Teusday Dec 8th 1874  Today is very beautiful, we ordered the Carriage at eleven and went calling at the Grand Pacific, called on Mr Fred Grant, Misses Chappell. Mrs Barter, Mrs Keen, Mrs Capt Gray. Misses Medill Mrs & Misses Keep.  went for Mr Angell and brought him home with us he is going to New York at five, Mrs Henry Rogers and Mr Smith called.  Wednesday Dec 9th 1874,  Again we have a mild day, all of us well. Eva gone down town with Mr Will Angell. Eva received a dispatch from her husband, he had arrived at London. Miss Kyle came to fit my black silk, my black, satin, and my velvet dress. Mr F Allport called to night, after tea Mr Badger went down to keep an engagement with Sam Walker.  Miss Pemcomb of Louisville is dead.  Mr J.R. McKay and Mrs Walton Duane, called,  Thursday Dec 10th 1874,  Today has been mild and clear. All of us well. Eva and Ada went out early to ride, Belle called with her baby and spent the morning.  Robby stayed all day with Hunt. I had several callers today. Mr Wm. J Hancock, Mrs Arthur B Meeker, Misses Buckingham, Mrs Dan Thompson, Miss Ward Mrs C.H. Leavering. Miss Adsitt, Mrs Ezra Wheeler, Mrs Thompson, after supper Mr Badger Ada and myself all went to the reception of Mrs Huntington who is to be married to Mr Wilson, they had a lovely party and everything passed beautifully.  Mrs Waters and Mrs Adams called, so did Mrs French & Mrs Ogden

note top left:  Mr Angell arrived 14 +   Friday Dec 11th 1874  note top right:  girl coat X  Mary Richards X 14  Another mild day. All well. Belle came up with her baby and Bobby and spent the morning. Eva went out with her shopping. Sheridan bought a new coat + with pony skirts. Ada had gone to Belle,s to go with her to the Beethoven Society. after tea Miss Kyle came and sewed some for me. Our old Bridget Mahoney came to see us. After tea Mr Badger went down town and came home at 12 o'clock. Mr. L Grand Burton called to see Ada.  Saturday Dec 12, 1874,  This has been a beautiful day. So mild, all of us well. My new black has been finished to day. So had Ada,s a garnet serge. Ada gone to her French class, Mrs Neall McCormick called, I went to see Belle this afternoon and took Hunt and Ada with me. We went to the new market of Field and Leiters on State near 18 st. Ada making a new buff tarletan. Mamie Kite of Louisville went off an got married without her Parents consent. Rob Harvey is six to day. Mrs Barclay called,  Sunday, Dec 13, 1874  It is cloudy but not cold. I went to church with my three boys and Ada, after church called to see Belle. Found them all well.  have remained at home the rest of the day.  Monday, Dec 14, 1874.  The ground was all covered with snow this morning. all of us well. Hunt  out playing in snow. My new German + + girl named Mary Richards came to day. Mr. Angell arrived from New York this morning, Eva gone down with him at six O.clock.  Mr. Badger Ada and myself all went to a Kettledrum at Mr. Henry L. Neills, on Calumet Avenue  Teusday Dec 15, 1874.  The snow is still on the ground but is melting.  all of us back busy fixing for the party.  As Mrs Henry Wheeler,s Eva went out shopping.  We went to the party at nine, came home from the party at 12.  Ada went with us.  and had a good time, wore yellow silk and yellow tarletan scarlet flowers.  I wore black satin trimmed with jet.

Wednesday Dec 16, 1874  The snow has melted and it is now raining all of us well. I had a letter from Mattie Faulds she says her Ma is still sick. My girl Maria left +  + to day, going out of the City to her Mother,s  Thursday Dec 17, 1874.  To day had been cloudy until three O,clock when the sun shone brightly, all of us well but Eva, she has a severe cold and headache.  Mrs Harris called to day. Mr Badger and I went to the assembly, and Ada went with Mr Stewart Clark, she quite a Belle, her programme filled the moment she entered the hall. I danced with Mr Fred Smith, Mr Brunner, Mr G. Lunt Mr S. Clark Mr Adams, Mr Hunter  Friday Dec 18, 1874,  This has been a bright sunny day, but wind high Eva sick last night and to day with severe cold.  Belle Mr Harvey Bobby Maggie and baby came up to lunch  Ada and I went calling, went to see Mrs Judge Caton Mrs Tree Mrs Farnsworth Mrs Dan Jones Mrs Shaw.  Mrs Meldrum Mrs BF. Allen Mrs Mahl Misses Buckingham Mrs Chris Barnes Mrs Kelly Mrs unclear Dexter Mrs Edson Keith  Misses Medill called on us with their mother, after tea Mr Badger and I went to see Mr Leiter we also went to Dr Gunn,s to see his telescope which we enjoyed in his observatory. Mr Allport called to night, Misses Buckingham, Miss Wheelbranch  Major John B Rice is dead. Miss Emma B. Beuch came with Miss Buckingham  Saturday Dec 19, 1874  This has been a lovely day, all well but Eva, she has cold, Ada gone to her French class, my two boys Sheridan and Shreve gone to dancing school. after lunch Ada and I called in Mrs Luther Shreve, Mrs John Clark, Florence, Mrs L. B Jenkins  Sheridan and Shreve invited Wednesday to a party at Mrs Van Schauck. Mr Badger and all our family is invited to Mr Spruance on Wednesday.  Sunday Dec 20, 1874  The ground is covered with a light snow, it is cold and blustering, all of us well. Ada was the only one who went to church. Belle came up with her baby and Nurse and spent a few hours, her baby has fever and I think cold, they went home at three O,clock.  +

Monday Dec 21st 1874.  It has been mild to day - all of us well, I went out in my Carriage at two O,clock with Ada, went on the West Side, call to see Belle her baby better. returned home late, we are busy with Christmas,  Teusday Dec 22nd 1874.  This had been a mild day, all of us well. I ordered out the Carriage at ten O,clock, and Eva and I went to Belle,s found all better of their colds there. then went to Market. and then shopping. found all the stores, well filled with people, all in search of Christmas, came home at three O,clock, and brought Ada home from Dr Allports. Sheridan and Shreve went out in the Buggy, they got quite cold. after tea Ada went in our Carriage to see Hamlet with Mrs Allport. Mrs Ives called to see Eva.  Wednesday Dec 23rd 1874  This has been a mild day with some snow all of us well, I have been busy all day fixing Ada,s and my dress for the party to night at Mrs Spruance, Eva and Hunt gone down town. Shreve had cold in his eye, but he went to school, we went to the party and enjoyed it I wore black satin with net overdress of black and scarlet flowers. Ada wore white tarleton trimmed in pink flowers. She had much attention Mrs Arnold Morris the artist called.  Thursday Dec 24, 1874  A bright sunny day, all of us well, we had garlands of green hung in our parlour to day for Christmas I went to the toy shop with children, it was cold there To night we are our Christmas tree fixed in the parlour  Friday Dec 25, 1874  This has been a glorious bright sunny day, quite mild Ada and Sheridan went to the Express Office early for a box expected from Louisville the Office was closed, all of us well. I went to church with Shreve, early this morning all my children were up calling Merry Christmas, they all had their stockings filled after church we went to Belle,s they had a splendid tree with gifts for every one, some very expensive we

note top left:  over picture  +   Christmas day 25 Dec, 1874.  had a lovely day. Ada received lovely gifts so did we all, after a fine dinner, we all returned home, and we find our own tree which was beautiful and we had gifts for all. Mr Angell and Eva spent much time and money on their gifts. after our tree was finished we had Cake and Ice Cream we received the Louisville box this afternoon and it was full of beautiful gifts for us all. I received Hunts picture  painted by Cooper of Louisville, it was an excellent picture.  Saturday Dec 26, 1874.  Another lovely day, all of us Well, and delighted with our gifts. I sent for Mamie and Judie Leiter and gave them a little gift of the tree  after lunch I went to Belle,s with Eva Ada & Hunt, saw her new portrait but I don't like it. I then went to dancing school to night Mrs P. D. Smith called.  Sunday Dec 27, 1874  This is a cloudy and drizzling day, all of us Well. but no one went to church. Eva sent for Dr Small to give her something for her cold which hangs on. Hunts portrait came from Louisville on the 25, an excellent likeness an oil + painting  Monday Dec 28, 1874.  This has been a mild day, all of us Well. I dressed to day a doll for Mr Locke,s Christmas tree. I then went to Belle,s and stayed the afternoon after tea Mrs Ogden called with Mrs Catie Isaacs  Lunt came to lunch with us to day. Mr J B. Drake called. Belle has a Porcelain picture printed by J. A. Morris an Englishman, he charged her 200 & 50 dollars for it  Teusday Dec 29, 1874  This has been a cold day, everything frozen. all of us Well I am making Ada a new white tarletan with white satin overdress. it will be pretty, she is going to Mrs Winston,s Ada and I called on Mrs J. Young at the Palmer house. also on Mrs Boone and Mrs Grass, we called on Belle, and when we got home, Mr Harvey and Belle were at our house. Octave gone to night to Louisville

Wednesday Dec 30, 1874.  This has been a clear day but cold, all of us well.  I am busy making Ada a white Tarletan trimmed with white Satin for Mrs Winstons party to night.  Sheridan attended a party at Mr Van Schauck to night.  Shreve had a cold in his eye and could not go.  I wrote a letter home to my Father & Mother to night.  Thursday Dec 31st 1874.  This is the last of the old year, it tried to snow but failed, all of us Well.  Eva gone out to buy Hunt red shoes; I am busy getting the house ready for to morrow New Years.   Charley Gray here helping us to clean up.  Adas french class met here to day.  Mrs Hilton here to sell us a ticket to the Charity ball at Mrs Wall,s.  Sheridan gone to Grandpa,s in the Buggy to invite them in to spend New Years  Octave gone to Louisville  X  Friday Jan 1st 1875.  X  To day has been mild, all of us Well.  I woke at seven dressed myself and commenced to get things in readiness for our New Years Callers.  dressed Hunt in White cloth suit with red boots and sash.  myself in Pearl silk red flowers,  Ada in pink silk with paris Muslim Overdress.  Eva in pale green silk, Mrs H. Lunt in dark green silk and Miss Lilly Schroeder in blue silk with white striped overskirt, we lit the gas in the whole house and had our table filled with all kind of good things, everything looked beautifully, our first caller came at nine Mr & Mrs H Lunt from Evanston, I sent my carriage for Miss Schroeder.  Our Callers continued to come untill eleven o,clock.  Our band of music played most beautiful and all day.  and our company joined in merry dance.  Mr Harvey & Belle came up to see us after their music and company had all gone.  She had many calls, we had about 200 and 50 people call.  Mr & Mrs Lunt will stay all night, Mr Badger Mr Henry and Mr Angell made many calls, my two boys went in my Carriage and made some calls.

note top left:  party. Belle one month  Saturday Jan 2nd 1875  note top right:  tooth  X   This has been a beautiful sunny day, all of us well, Mrs Dr Locke sent for me to come to a lunch party at one, I went and enjoyed it very much  there were eight ladies beside Dr. Locke's wife Mrs Peck Mrs Gillespie Mrs Lovering Mrs Johnson Mrs Runnion and Mrs  McCurdy and Rev Mr McCurdy  I left at half past three.  Came home in my Carriage took Eva and Hunt and called to see Belle, her baby has her first tooth she is eight months old  X  Sunday Jan 3rd 1875  The sun has shone brightly to day, all of us well.  I went to church this morning with Shreve, found Mr Harvey and Belle in our pew, I took them home in my Carriage and stayed a few minutes to see the baby.  Mr Badger and Sheridan have gone to see old Mr Voorhees who is out of health  Monday Jan 4th 1875  This has been a bitter cold day all of us well,  Belle came up to spend the day with Robby Maggies baby.  Mr Harvey came to lunch, my two boys went to school this is the first day, after the Holidays  Mrs Wm E. Strong called on Eva and myself.  Mrs W.G Grant came to invite Mr Badger and myself to a tea party at half past six on Wednesday  Teusday Jan 5th 1875  To day has been cold bitter cold, all of us well none of us went out to day, but at eight O.clock Mr Badger Ada with Henry Walker and myself all went to the Assembly.  there was a large number of persons present, Mr Harvey and Belle came they danced the German and Ada was a great belle, and received many favors.  Mr Wiley called to see us, we are invited to a party at Mrs Kimballs  Wednesday Jan 6th 1875.  Another sunny day.  all of us well.   Belle and her baby came up to see us.  Eva is talking of giving a German.  Sheridan is at home to day with cold.  at half past six Mr Badger and I went to a tea at Mrs W.G Grants.  Spent a pleasant evening,

Thursday Jan 7, 1875  This has been a cold day but suny.  all of us Well,  Much to my amazement I learned this morning that Mrs John Patterson (nee Jeanie Stewart) was dead, she leaves a baby four days old, the family are much grieved, we feel sad about it,  to day Mrs Hibbard called so did Mrs Gunn and daughter.  Friday Jan 8, 1875  This has been a good morning, at eleven O,clock Eva Ada Mr Angell and myself all went to the funeral of Jenny strikeout Stewart Patterson, she leaves a baby four days old, her funeral was largely attended by all her many friends, she will be much missed, her old Father and two young Sisters are all that are left.  I feel very sad about Jeannie,s death  Eva and I went to see Mrs Davidsons Sister at Mrs Graftons, then to the Henry Walters family, Misses Rogers and Mrs McCormick  We then stopped at Belle,s and came home late  It was snowing fast and turning very cold.  Saturday Jan 9, 1875  This is the coldest day this winter, all of us well, it is 28 below, our house is very comfortable  it is heated all over with steam, and we dont feel that it is cold, Mr Badger had a fall on the snow, and feels to night quite Sore,  I head from Mary to day that Mrs Jeannie Patterson died from cold, she had a violent chill.  Sunday Jan 10 1875  Another cold day but not so cold as yesterday, all of us well, no one went to church, all stayed at home and ate candy.  and had a good time.  Eva talks of giving a party.  Monday Jan 11th 1875  To day it has moderated, we all in health, Ada and I have been quite busy making a party dress for her of white Tarletan trimmed in blue,  Eva gone out in our carriage, Belle and her baby came up to see us  Mrs Leiter quite unwell  Mrs Heny Field quite ill with Typhoid Fever, Mr Badger Ada and I went up to Mrs Kimball,s party, and met many friends, Belle & Mr Harvey there

note top left:  Vaccinated +    Teusday Jan 12th 1875  This has been a mild day.  all of us Well.  We went visiting, and called on many people at the Palmer house; Mr Henry Field very ill with Typhoid fever.  his brother just died in New York  called on Mrs Leiter, she sick with Rheumatism, I went to bed feeling bad from being out So long all day.  Mr Burton ill,  Wednesday Jan 13th 1875  It snowed to day Several times, and a great Many Cutters are out.  after lunch I went out calling with Eva and Ada  We only made a few calls when our Carriage pole broke and we sent it home.  and Belle let me have her Carriage and she went with us, and we went on the North Side and saw many ladies,  Mrs Stiles Burton is dead, Mr Field no better, we called on Mrs Spruance, Mrs Wilson, Mrs Leonard, Mrs McGregor Adams & Miss Jewett,  I engaged a German girl to day for sewing, Pauline Gabler  Mr & Mrs Harvey came up to night, they intend to give a party & + Belle,s baby was vaccinated to day.  Thursday Jan 14, 1875  This has been a clear cold day, all of us Well, Eva gone to walk, Mr Temple Wayne Mr James Wayne and Miss Wayne called, Mrs Tuttles two boys here to night playing Billiards with mine, at eight O,clock we went to the Assembly and spent a pleasant evening.  I danced with Mr Hunter, Mr Adams Mr Kimball strikeout and Col Nelson, Ada had a splendid time, and plenty of beau,s, she invited to a party at Mrs Julian Rumsey, also at Mrs Judge Rogers.  Friday Jan 15, 1874  It has moderated I ordered the Carriage to go to Mr Burtons funeral, but it came round too late  We went calling first to Mrs Ryerson, & then Mrs Winstons Mrs Perry Smith Mrs Chetlains Mrs G L. Dunlops then took lunch with Belle, sent our Carriage home and told him to come back at four.  Called on Mrs W C, Grant & Miss Murison, after tea  My boys had a tea party, invited George Meeker Miss Fitch and Miss Hunt, Jenny Hunt sick with Pneumonia

note top left:  Lena  Saturday Jan 16, 1875  note top right:  Pauline  This has been a sunny bright day, not very cold  all of us Well,  Eva and Hunt gone walking.  After lunch I took Hunt and went to dancing school to see Sheridan and Shreve dance,  Eva came in my Carriage to bring us home, after Tea Belle and Mr Harvey talked party with us  they were at times with us, we enjoyed them  Sunday Jan 17, 1875.  It has been snowing all day.  all of us Well.  Ada and Sheridan went to church, Eva and Mr Angell went downtown, Shreve went to see Belle for a little while,  it is still snowing so sleighing will be good to morrow  Monday Jan 18, 1875  It snowed all night and is still snowing it is several inches thick, and it is embanked on both sides of the street several feet high, all of us Well,  Miss Kyle came this morning to make me a helmet Basque, also one for Ada, it is quite warm, Hunt and my boys out Sleighing in our Cutter, after lunch Ada took the Cutter and went for Mr Angell.  George Meeker took Ada out + for a sleigh ride.  My new girl Pauline came to day +  Lena came home from her visit to night. +  Teusday Jan 19, 1875  The snow is quite thick and sleighing splendid, Eva and Hunt went sleighing all of us Well.  We received letters from home all well there but Virginia she still sick, Miss Kyle sewing for me  Ada and Mr Badger gone to night to Mr Julian Rumsey,s party, Ada dressed in white  Wednesday Jan 20, 1875  It is cold and everything covered with snow, all of us Well  Mrs George strikeout 3 words Farnsworth and Miss Farnsworth, Miss Kyle here making my dress.  at Nine O clock, Ada went to the strikeout party with Junius Smith, and the party was held at the house of Judge Rogers.  Thursday Jan 21, 1875  It has been quite mild, all of us Well, Ada went sleighing with George Meeker, Father L M Badger spent the day with us  Ada took him sleighing.  Belle and Mr Harvey came to see us, so did Mrs Judge & Dr Caton & daughter  Mrs Keen called so did Misses Stager, Mr Norman Williams  Eva & Mr Angell gone to the Opera

Friday Jan 22, 1875  The sun shone so brightly that Eva and I went visiting called on Mrs Whitehead Miss Lyman Mrs strikeout Norton Mrs Eastman, Mrs W. Herfoot Mrs Dr Brooks Mrs Ed Muller, Mrs Carleton & Mrs High  Belle sent for me to see her baby she is broken out with a thick rash we think it is the measeles but it has not made her sick yet. Mrs S. L. Walker called on us.  Saturday Jan 23 1875  It has been a mild day, everyone out sleighing  all of us Well,  I went to the Dentist with Eva his name Dr. Brown, I then went to Belle, & her baby better  Dr Small says it is not measles she had, but the effect of the vaccination.  Ada gone to the Opera with Mr Frank Allport   Eva Mr Angell Mr Badger and myself all going  to Belle, to supper.  Miss Parnell called on me  Sunday Jan 24, 1875  This has been a clear cold sunny day, all of us well.  I went to church with Ada & Sheridan, after church I went to see Belle her baby better, her rash was only the effect of the vaccination, it was not measles, as we thought.  Mr Badger gone to his Fathers, house.  Monday Jan 25, 1875  Today is sunny but cold, all of us well, Ada gone to see Miss Schroeder and Miss blank of Louisville  Eva gone with Mr Angell to call on a bride Mrs blank Miss Kyle my dress maker here to sew with me,  Ada gone to the Opera Lohengrin with Mr. George Meeker, Miss Wadsworth sent Ada invitations to a German at her house, (Palmer Hotel)  Teusday Jan 26 1875,  Another good sunny day but cold, snow and ice every where to be seen, the Lake is frozen over a long distance and may skate on it.  Miss Kyle finished to day dressmaking for me for a while, Eva gone down town shopping, Mrs & Miss Andrews called so did the Misses Kelly.  Mr & Mrs Harvey came up and dined with us, after ten Mr Britton called to see Ada,

note top left:  Hobby +  Wednesday Jan 27, 1875  note top right:  Duretta +  This has been a bad day -- everything melting and raining slightly all day, but warm, none of us have been out to day, all Well, at six O,clock Ada Sheridan Shreve and Hunt all went to Charlie Grant,s party and had a delightful time, I went to the Opera of Sonnambula with Mr Badger Mr Angell and Eva, we enjoyed it very much, the Prima donna was Mlle Emma Albani she sings well  Col Brown called to say good bye.  He is going to New York to live.  Thursday Jan 28, 1875  This has been a clear mild day, all Well, Ada gone riding, It is my reception day So I did not go out  My boys are forming a Millitary company, and Mr Angell is their Captain, Mrs Col Farrar called on me, so did Miss Schroeder & Sister Mrs G.A. Colby. Miss Jernett 2112 Walnut St  ) Mrs W B Grafton Miss Graves & Miss F Davidson of Canada Miss Holiday  after tea Mr Badger Ada Miss Schroeder and myself all went to the Assembly.  and enjoyed it, It is the last one  I danced with Mr Pike Wm McCauley Mr Adams, Dr. Jones and Mr Kelly.  Ada danced all the time, Ada did not go to Miss Murisons party  Friday Jan 29, 1875  This has been a chilly day.  Towards night it snowed, all of us well, all the Meeker children have the Measles  Lennie Hunt still ill, at ten O,clock Eva and I went over on the west side to do some shopping then went to Belle,s and staid to dinner, after dinner returned home with Mr Badger, he came down in the Carriage for me  I brought Robby home with me to stay a few days.  Duretta the old German Nurse has left Mr Harvey, & she is not well enough to take care + + of the boys.  I went out with Belle to find a Nurse girl  Mr Kent and Mr R Eddy called to see Ada, she is invited to Miss Catons to a party.  Col Brown came to day to say good bye  he goes to Philadelphia to live

note top left:  Pants birthday +   Saturday Jan 30th 1875. It has been mild to day, all of us well. Hunt and Robbie Harvey out on the ice sliding. Sheridan skating, Shreve gone to the clothing store with his Father in the sleigh to get a new pair of pants & Eva gone with Mr. Angell to lunch, then they are going to the Matinee of Faust given by Albani  Ellen Scanlan our old Nurse came to see us. she brought a pretty worsted Jacquard doll to baby Harvey. Ada gone to French class. after tea Mr G. Y. Bryan and Mr Pearson D Smith came to see Ada. Shreve gone to dancing school after church. Sheridan & George Meeker gone to the West side Rink they did not come home untill late  Sunday Jan 31, 1875  This has been a bright sunny day. I went to church with Ada, after church went to See Belle, left Ada there to dinner, they came up to tea with me, Mr Harvey Belle and Charlie Robbie will stay a few day with us longer.  Monday Feb 1st, 1875  Another bright suny day, all of us well. Heard to day through the papers that old Mr. Faulds was ill and David had gone on, to New York. Eva and Ada out sleighing  George Meeker took Hunt & Robbie to ride, they very happy over + it  this is Sheridan's birthday Miss Kreigh and Mr Egan called to day. so did  Mrs Noyes and Mr   Ada called to day on Mister Rogers, Miss Phillips Mr Murison  she went with Miss Schroeder, after tea Mr Burnsides called,  Teusday Feb 2nd 1875  This has been a blustering day, all of us well, Eva took my carriage and went shopping until three O,clock  Belle is having some altering in her room, having a door for winter  Ada and I all day making dress for to night, the party is given strikeout the strikeout Palmer house by the Misses Wadsworth.  it rained to night Mrs C. M. Henderson sent party tickets for us all to a party at her house.  Miss Fleetwood called and invited Ada to a lunch party at her house on Thursday.  Ada gone to night with Mr Hunt to the party.

note top left:  the teeth  ╪   Wednesday Feb 3rd 1875  It stormed all night and today the wind is frightful and everything is one sheet of ice. and it is very cold. all of us Well. I went down to Belle,s and spent the morning, it was with difficulty that the horses could stand  Belle is having a door cut between her rooms and everything is in confusion, her baby well and lovely. She stayed with me all morning she has three teeth and weighs thirty + pounds, to night was the Apollo club but the weather is so bad that we have given it up. Miss Bergstein is to sing.  Robby still with us.  Belle has engaged a German girl as Nurse for the boys. her name is Minnie  Thursday Feb 4th 1875  This has been a sunny day but bitter cold, all of us Well. Ada went to Miss Fleetwoods to a lunch party.  I am making her a new white Tarletan for Miss Caton,s party.  it is embroidered all over with red roses.  Robby still with us.
