Mr Badger gone to Caton,s party with Ada.  Mr Ogden called to night. to see Ada. she has returned and is delighted with the party. Miss McDougall married to day to Mr Horace White  Friday Feb 5, 1875  It has moderated. some still everything is covered with ice all of us well. little Bobby Small had his birthday to day, he is six years old.  he is Dr Smalls grandson. I ordered the carriage and went to see Belle, found them all well. stood awhile, then went to Field and Leiter,s to do some shopping  Sat Feb 6,th 1875  It is again cold. everything ice, all of us well. there seems to be a great deal of accident on the rail roads this cold snap Mr Harvey came for Robby to take him home he has been a week with us. Mrs Capt Tomilson and Miss Gordon called so did Misses Rogers and Miss Gerum  Sheridan and Shreve gone to dancing school.  after lunch I went down in the carriage to see Belle, then went to Market,  Ada gone to night to the Old Folks Concert with Mr Thayer.  Sunday Feb 7, 1875  Went to church with Ada and Shreve. very cold but sunny all of us well. called a moment to see Belle.  at four O,clock we returned to Belle's and took tea. a dispatch came from Louisville to invite us to the Mardi Gras

note top left:  Jennie Hunt died +  Monday Feb 8, 1875  Another clear sunny day, all of us Well.  took my Carriage and went to see Belle with Ada. we found it very cold so hurried home and brought Mr Badger home with us. Ada and I talk of going to night to Louisville but Mr Badger has persuaded us out of it. I called to see Mrs Leiter, her son Josie sick, Dr and Mrs Kelly and Mrs Will Angell took tea with us, I mean Mr Will Angell, came in after tea. Belle has changed her servants to Germans and she likes them. Catie Lunt spent day with Belle  Teusday Feb 9th 1875  Again a blustering day, but sunny, all of us Well. Alice Hilton called to invite us to a surprise party at her mother house, the anniversary of their twenty fifth wedding day.  Lena gone to dress Belle for the parties to night. Mr James Foster called, at nine o. clock  Mr Badger Ada and myself went to Mrs Ed Isham party. met many people. staid there until eleven, then went to Mrs C. M. Henderson,s party. met Mr and Mrs Harvey at both places, this being Shrove Tuesday we had pancakes for supper  Wednesday Feb 10th 1875  It is mild to day and it is snowing very fast the heaviest fall of snow we have had this winter  at eleven o,clock Ada and I went to church, there was a large attendance, after church went to see Belle, found them all well, then went and paid several of my bills  when we returned home we were astonished to see White Crape on Mrs Hunt's door, Jeannie died last night after twelve O, clock, it was a shock to every one, she thirteen year old, her poor mother is a widow with only one child left (Lizzie)  Thursday Feb 11, 1875  The sun shines brightly but it is very cold, there is a great deal of snow on the ground, after breakfast I took my sleigh and went down with my driver Thomas to visit my daughter Belle for a few minutes, found them all well, returned home. Mr Keep and Miss Keep called to see us  at five O,clock I went to church with Ada and sent the Carriage for Belle and Mr Harvey  it was so bitter cold that we came home quickly.

note top left:  + buried (Jennie Hunt)  Friday Feb 12, 1875  It snowed again last night and is not quite so cold, all of us Well.  Splendid sleighing, I sent downtown and bought two Bouquets for Sheridan the Shreve to send to the funeral of Jennie Hunt.  at One O clock I went with Ada Sheridan and Shreve, to the funeral.  there were many there, and many girl from her school.  the flowers were very grand and profuse, she was beautifully dressed in white Cashmere and Satin, at five O,clock I went to Afternoon Service, then to Belle,s all her family well.  after tea Mr C Bryan Mr Farnas and Mr Britton came to see Ada  Saturday Feb 13 1875  This has been a clear sunny day my boys out with their sleigh and Pony.  Eva out visiting in my Carriage Ada gone to her French class.  George and Robby Harvey spent the day with Hunt.  after supper I went with Mr Badger Ada Sheridan and Shreve to Mrs J.C. Hiltons, her children and husband gave her a surprise party.  We met at the grocery next their house and when all the company had arrived we marched into their house and sent for her to come down stairs, and she was amazed to see all of us.  and gifts were given her and we had dancing and music.  Mr Hilton had three omnibuses on runners at his door to take us home and we had a merry sleigh ride.  It was the anniversary of their 25 year strikeout of their wedding.  everything passed off well.  Sunday Feb 14, 1875  Another bright and sunny day, all of us Well.  It is very cold.  Ada and Sheridan gone to church.  Belle & her baby came up and spent the day.  Mr Harvey and the boys came after her in their Carriage.  we did not get off to night to Louisville  Monday Feb 15, 1875  Again the weather is very cold but clear and sunny. snow everywhere.  all of us Well.  Ada gone to make some calls.  Sheridan out sleighing.  Belle and Mr Harvey came up to say good bye to us as we leave in an hour for Louisville.  Miss Abby Hamilton and Misses Chappell called on us to day.  at eight Oclock we said good bye to all and got into our Carriage and went to the train.

Mr Faulds died  9  Teusday Feb 16, 1875.  Louisville 14.  Mr Badger Hunt and myself had the drawing room and had every comfort possible; spend a good and safe night and arrived at Indianapolis at four O,clock in the morning, remained in our car and at eight O,clock went into the Depot and took our breakfast.  got again into the cars and travelled along delightfully, and arrived at my Fathers at two O,clock.  Found all the family at home and surprised them very much as they did not expect us.  took our dinner and sat down and chatted until our tea.  Mr David Faulds has just returned from New York, where he has been for three weeks nursing his Father.  who died last Tuesday aged 82.  Wednesday Fab 17, 1875.  It is beautiful and sunny weather here.  but cold still there is no snow any where to be seen.  all of us well.  My Mother Father two Sisters and their five children are looking very well.  Mrs Bolling called to see me.  after dinner I went out driving with Mrs Shreve and her children  Mr Badger went in the Carriage with Mattie and Octane.  Hunt has received a number of Valentines.  Thursdy Feb 18, 1875  This has been a sunny day, and not so cold.  all of us well but Hunt has had a diarrhea for three days.  I think it must be cold.  My Father Mother Sisters and children are all in good health.   Mrs Faulds my Sister will never be well.  She had been an invalid for 23 years, but I think she feels better than she did one year ago.  My Mother is feeble but not sick.  My Father all right.  Mrs Bolling called again to see me.  We saw Dr. Scott, he called to see Mattie Faulds.  I called on Mrs Charles Johnson but she was out.  We the went riding.  I wrote home to Belle & Eva and Hunt sent Valentines to little Mamie Leiter strikeout Altie Stone and baby Harvey.  Mattie Belle played beautifully on the piano for us.  She is gifted both vocally and instrumentally  Friday Feb 19, 1875.  This morning the ground was covered with snow but to night it is all gone.  al of us well except Hunt but he is better with his diarrhea, Miss Lizzie Hunt called to see me Mr Hulece came to see Virginia who he is treating for internal troubles and I was very glad to see him.  and he was glad to see Hunt and myself.  after supper Mr Badger went to see Mrs A.D. Hunt and saw her.  Sister Belle talks of letting Tom Shreve go home with us to Chicago

Saturday Feb 20th 1875 The sun has shone brightly today, and it is not cold. all of us well but Hunt, he has still trouble in his bowels. after dinner I called to see Mrs A.D. Hunt, Mrs Hemming and Mrs Chas Lewis, Mrs Morton Morris called to see me. after supper Mr Hunt called to see us and spent the evening. I received a letter from Eva, they all well. Sunday Feb 21 1875 Again the sun is shining, all of us well. Hunt about the same. James David and myself all went to Christ church. Mr Craik preached. I saw many friends, all compliments me very much about looking young and well. Monday Feb 22 1875. It has turned very warm. People can go without their overcoats here today in Louisville. It is like spring. all of us well. Hunt has his loose bowels yet but it dont make him sick. Mr Perry,s two little girls named Mary and Angie came here today to play and sing for us. Mary is ten years old and Angie 8, they are little wonders. I called to see Mrs R. Hopkins and Mrs Chas Shreve came to see me. Teusday Feb 23rd 1875. It has rained most of the day, and is very warm. all of us well. Hunt much better. Mrs Holden came to see me and wanted me to take her to Chicago to live with me as seamstress. Miss Schroeder called to see me. Mr Badger gone to see Rev Heywood. We spend out day at home with our Parents and relations. Octave here yet. Wednesday Feb 24, 1875 Today has been as warm as summer, too warm for [strikeout: summer]] winter clothes, all of us well. Hunt much better. we went to Dr Hulcee's Office to see his Museum, it is most excellent then I called on Mrs Sallie Pope, Mrs Chas Shreve and started for Mrs Hunts but it rained and we all returned home and had a nice dinner. Mrs Hemming called to see me. Thursday Feb 25 1875 The ground today was covered with snow, and its turned quite cold. such a change from yesterday. I called to see Mrs Ike Caldwell, Mrs Bolling, Mrs Morton Morris, Mrs Sallie Ward Hunt and went to see an old servant of mine Ellen, now Mrs Tom Halleran, all of us well. we received a letter from Belle in Chicago my oldest daughter, she says they are all well.

[note top left:  Louisville Feb 28 + ]] Friday Feb 26 -- 1875.  note top right:  Tom Shreve Feb 28, +  Again we have had a bright sunny day, and quite warm.  All of us well.  I received a letter from Ada.  She says all of our family are well in Chicago.  I went with Mattie Faulds to see Mrs Dumesnil and her X daughter Mary Belknap.  then called on Mrs Dulany and daughter.  Returned to dinner and after tea called to see Mrs AD. Hunt and Lizzie, found all my friends at home.  Saturday Feb 27, 1875.  The sun has shone brightly today, but it is cold, all of us well, Hunt much better. I went with Mattie at twelve O,clock to the Gospel meeting, there was a large crowd there of real nice people.  we then went shopping  I called to see Miss Schroeder.  at eight O,clock David my Sister Belle, Mattie Belle and myself all got into the Carriage and went to Mrs Dave,s Caldwell,s to a Musical given for the young ladies of 12 and 16 years of age.  Mattie Belle Shreve played and sung, and received great applause.  She excelled all the girls present in both.  They called her the great Prima Donna, she is 15 years old.  the names of the girls were Claire Johnson, Mamie Pettit, Lilly Durrett, Mamie Caldwell, Mamie Winston, Luly Henning, Minnie Osborn strikeout 2 words Jenny Hamilton, Miss Agatha Caldwell, blank Johnson Miss Effie Rogers, Marie Hawkins  Thursday Feb 28 1875  This is a bright sunny day, all of us well.  Hunt well today.  None of us went to church but Mattie Belle & Jamie.  Mrs A.D. Hunt came to see me to say good bye.  Sister Belle came to my room and said she had decided to let Tom go home with me to  go to school then she took a big cry over it.  we got ourselves all ready took our supper said good bye and at half past seven X started for the Depot, Ma sent to my boys ten dollars and Sis sent a gift to each child, Tom Shreve brought his trunk and started to Chicago with us.  we travelled untill twelve then reached Indianapolis and got the Drawing Room and had all four beds made up.  and Mr Badger Tom Hunt, and myself took a bed a piece.  we spent a good night and arrived two hours behind time

[[note top left: strikeout:  Louisville Ky + ]]  Monday March 1st 1875  note top right:  Tom  We reached Chicago at quarter before nine, it is a terrible blustering windy snowing cold morning.  All of us Well.  We found Sheridan at the Depot, and the Carriage for us.  Started for home and saw Mrs Hibbard and Husband going to New Orleans.  When we reached home, found Belle, Eva Ada and (Nancy our black cook) all at the door waiting X for delighted to see us.  all look well.  They had a nice breakfast for us, everything look well at home.  Eva makes a good housekeeper, my boys look very well, they were very happy to see Tom, I sent Belle home in my Carriage, I heard of the death of little blank Ritcher, it is a great loss, to his parents  Teusday March 2nd 1875  It is a lovely day.  plenty of snow and fine sleighing, but not cold, I went to Belle,s and took Tom Shreve and we spent the day.  found them all well, the baby Belle has two teeth and can say a great many words, and sing, but cant walk yet.  Belle took us out to drive, then we took lunch and came home.  Mr Harvey,s Father & Mother arrived to stay sometime with them.  Duretta ill she at her brother,s.  Eva went out sleigh riding all of us well.  Wednesday March 3rd 1875  This is one of the worst day this winter, the snow is falling fast and there is a hurricane of wind driving along the street.  Every where the snow is embanked several feet high.  It is a fearful day.  all of us well.  Hunt quite well,  My boys went to school, and are none at home shovelling off snow.  Ada,s music teacher for the voice came punctualy  we have remained at home all day.  Thursday March 4, 1875  This has been a glorious day for sleighing.  all of us well.  Ada went out and took cousin Tom and Hunt with her to sleigh, Belle and her baby with old Mr Harvey came up to see me.  Mrs R.H. Gardner called so did Miss Gardner.  Weather much warmer.  after tea Mr & Mrs Ferd Peck called to see us.  Tom Shreve,s new clothes came to day, so did his Fiddle case.  Friday March 5th 1875  It has been snowing all day all of us Well.  I went with Tom Shreve to Mrs Waters school and Mrs Allen,s school, to see if he liked them then we all went sleighing.  Ada gone with Mr Brittain to the Literary and Musical.  Ada will sing.  Shreve to night had an Earache.

note top left:  Pa,s birthday March 7 he is 77   Saturday March 6th 1875  This has been a splendid day.  all of us well.  My boys out sleigh riding.  after lunch I went to dancing school with Hunt.  then to see Mrs Leiter for a little while at five Oclock, Mr Badger and I went to Belle,s to dine spent a pleasant evening.  it was Charley,s thirteenth birthday.  Sunday March 7, 1875.  This has been a lovely day.  all of us well.  I went to church with Sheridan Shreve and Tommy.  Ada walked down with Mr Crocker.  to church, after church I went to see how Mrs Hilton was.  she has been ill, but is now better.  Then I went to Belle,s and stayed to dinner Mr Badger came for me in the sleigh, Eva and Mr Angell out on X on a drive, This is my Father,s birthday he is 77 years old  Monday March 8, 1875  A bright sunny day.  warm and beautiful.  but heaps of snow every where.  all of us well.  Ada gone sleighing with Tom in our sleigh, and later in the afternoon she went with George Meeker.  Belle and Mr Harvey took supper with us after ten Mr Angell Eva Mr Badger and myself all went to the Theatre on the West Side to see Raymond act in the play of Tellard?.  It was most excellent.  Mrs Kelly & daughter called to day. who live on Calumet.  Teusday March 9th 1875  This has been a mild day. snow melting.  Sleighs still running all of us well.  Mrs & Miss Markley called to day.  So did Miss Goodwin Mr & Mrs Leiter called to see us after tea and we were out  Belle came up and spent the day, and Mr Harvey came to tea also.  Mrs Hilton my Sisterinlaw is quite ill.  I sent for Dr Small to see Hunt who is not well in his bowels but he did not come.  Wednesday March 10th 1875  Another mild day but damp.  all of us well.  We received a letter from Pa and Tom got one from Uncle David   after lunch I went down town with my Eva Ada & Hunt then called on Belle, she had cold as was in bed and had sent for the Doctor.  George Meeker called this evening to see Ada.  Mrs Adams called but did not get in  Thursday March 11, 1875  It is very damp this entire day.  Ada gone to Hopsons to get a new bonnet.  all of us well.  Belle came up and spent the day.  but had a bad headache and laid down all the day ill.  Mr Harvey came in his Carriage for her, I went down and took tea with them.  Mr Badger came with the Carriage for me.  Jodie Leiter spent the day with Hunt

note top left:  Eva 14,  Friday March 12, 1875 note top right:  Belle 13  This is a beautiful bright day, but very Sloppy under foot as the snow is all melting, and there is fear of a flood, in the Country and in the Cellars,  Eva gone to inquire after Belle.  Belle,s baby came up to see me to day.  Mr blank Wilson called, after lunch I went to see Belle found her still in bed and with fever and cold in her head.  Some severe pain in her brain.  I stayed with her untill seven, my two boys and Tom went with George Meeker.  Ada,s new hat came home, it is white chip and blue ribbon, it is very pretty.  Saturday March 13, 1875  This has been a sunny warm day but very wet from the melting snow under foot.  all of us Well here at home but Belle is still quite sick with bad pain in her head.  I stayed almost all day with her.  Eva spent the morning with her.  Ada and George Meeker gone to see Mulberry Sellars at the Academy of Music.  So did Sheridan and T. Shreve Shreve Badger stayed at home.  To night Ada has gone to her Literary Class at Mrs Sharp,s, George Harvey spent the day with Hunt Mrs P.D. Smith called   X  Sunday March 14, 1875  X  The sun is shining brightly, Ada went to church, I went to Belle,s and spent the morning.  She is a little better  I came home to three O,clock dinner on account of Eva,s Birthday, had a splendid dinner finished with Ice Cream Cake and Charlotte Russe.  I then returned to Belle,s and spent the afternoon, Shreve came in the Phaeton for me at Seven, I returned home and we had Icream and Cake, all my family well.  So has ended Eva,s birthday, at seven O,clock it rained very hard,  Monday March 15, 1875.  This has been a very bad day.  high wind rain and snow and in every respect horrid  Jennie Keep came to beg me for some money for the old La fonts, Ada went down to see Belle, I went and stayed with Belle untill dark.  She is not so well to day.  Mrs Hilton has been ill but is now better, all of my family Well.

note top left:  Octave returned +  Teusday March 16, 1875 note top right:  at Belle,s  X   It have been snowing and blowing all day, all of us Well.  Robbie has come to stay all day, and perhaps two or three.  I went to see Belle, and found her the same no better, her head has a bad pain in it all the time  she still in bed.  Mr Badger came for me in the Carriage and I went home, Mrs Leiter invited Mr Badger myself Mr & Mrs Angell & Mr & Mrs Harvey to dine with her to morrow but we all declined, at five O,clock I went back to Belle,s and found her not so well.  Mrs Ogden and Mr H Walker called to night,  Wednesday March 17, 1875.  Another miserable day, all of us Well.  Belle lines struck out:  came up to stay all day, and sew on her dress she is altering, but after she had been in the house ten minutes she was compelled to go to bed  Wednesday March 17, 1875.  This has been another cold bad day.  Mr Harvey sent his Carriage for me to come down to stay with her.  I went and found her ill, her mouth tongue ear and face all swollen and sore and all the saliva and Mucus of the mouth dried and not flowing.  Dr Small was sent for and he thought perhaps her wisdom tooth had something to do with it and sent for the Dentist Brown and he pulled it out while she was in bed and her mouth so hard to open.  She stood it bravely and an hour after wards a nervous attack came on which seemed as if it choke her as the tongue was so swollen and gums would not open.  All this trouble came from a fresh cold taken upon the old cold.  all day we worked over her and all night  Thursday March 18, 1875  It is cold and blustering.  we can hardly warm our room.  Mr Harvey and I sat up all night, Belle still very ill, Dr thinks it Neuralgia of the whole head and face  her suffering is very great in her mouth tongue and the nerves of the face.  all of my family keep well.  I have sent Rob up to stay at my house untill Belle is well.  Mrs Adams and Mr Allport went to night to see Ada.  Friday March 19,  Another very cold blustering day.  Belle still very ill.  Suffering torture with he mouth and face.  cant eat at all feed her on Egg Nog.  To night Mr Harvey carried her into the next room, which is very warm.  the change made her worse.

note top left:  Kyle 23  Tom School X  Saturday March 20, 1875 note top right:  teeth +  Last night at seven O,clock, Belle had a bad spell which alarmed Mr Harvey and I very much.  We sent off in haste for Dr Small and Dr Johnson and for Mr Badger.  I think it was the crisis of her desease.  She had a rigid spell with mouth set and then a Severe Sweat in an hour after her pains were a little better.  We sat up all night with her, the change of room dont agree with her nerves it makes her too warm.  She spent a sleepless night and is so nervous that all her pains have returned, I rode home a moment this afternoon to change clothes  Sunday March 21st 1875.  This is a bright sunny day, Belle feeling worse from her bad night.  We sent for Dr Small to give her something to sleep.  We moved her back into her front room.  and she is feeling easier.  Her sufferings are not so bad to day, but she is very feeble.  We sat up with her most of the night.  all my family well.  They have been down to see me.  even little Hunt and Rob came down.  Monday March 22nd 1875  This is a beautiful sunny day.  all my family well.  Belle seems much better of all her troubles this morning if she only continues so.  Eva Ada Hunt Rob and Tom all came down to see me this morning.  Ada gone to buy a new brown silk dress.  Belle is now sleeping while I write, and I hope will wake up feeling refreshed.  Eva dont feel well.  a letter from Sister Belle in Louisville says all are well.  Belle,s baby has four teeth, she strong & well says several words and tries to walk.  Teusday March 23 1875  It looks like rain, Belle spent a bad night, with pain, and this morning is very drowsy with fever.  not any better, I feel quite discouraged,  We sat up part of the night and I laid on a sofa in the room but did not undress.  Dr Small says she has fever to day.  it is now two weeks since she was attacked.  all my family were well last night.  Eva is feeling fatigue very much.  Miss Kyle is making a dress for Ada  Mr Badger Ada Eva and Nancy Moone came to see Belle she is a black woman who minded Belle when a baby  Mrs Nelson Mrs Chapin and Mrs Cook and Mrs Read came to see Belle.

note top left:  Mr Angell New York 28   Wednesday March 24, 1875. note top right:  Belle better.   This has been a lovely sunny day. Belle spent a better night, and is this morning better. And food now had a little taste to it. She can chew a little. Her mouth and tongue is not so sore. She is very weak and don't yet sit up in bed but I think will soon. Mattie Faulds wrote her a letter. Mr. Badger spent a while here this morning and this afternoon, Eva spent morning. Hunt and Rob came to see us. Mrs. Kelly and daughters came to see Belle.  Thursday March 25, 1875.  This is a mild lovely day. Belle much better, she spent a very pleasant night. I think she will soon be up. I slept in her room last night. Mr. Badger came to see her soon. Miss Kyle is sewing up at my house today for Belle. She is done with Ada.  Friday March 26, 1875.  This is a beautiful day. Belle feels better, but very weak. Not strong enough to sit up but for a few minutes at a time. Eva called for me to go to Mrs. Hopsons to get her a new bonnet. We spent an hour down town. Mrs. Harvey sent me home in a hack at ten o'clock as Belle was better. Mrs. Hilton better but very weak.  Saturday March 27. This is a beautiful day, all of us well, Belle a little better, I went down in the Buggy at eight O.clock. At 12 she complained her head hurt her and fell asleep. When she awoke she was better. Mrs,. Wheelock & daughter called to see Belle. Eva and Hunt came down at seven O.clock. Mr. Badger Eva Sheridan Shreve. Tom Hunt and Robbie all came down to Belle Badger Harvey's birthday party. She had two cakes with a White wax candle in them, Ice Cream and Cakes. And a great many presents. Our Louisville relations all sent her beautiful presents. We had a good time. Maggie the Nurse girl gave baby a canary bird in its cage.  Sunday March 28, 1875.  This has been a beautiful day. All of my family well. I went to Belle's house and found her no better. She suffering from a pain in her head, it continued most of the day. Eva and Mr. Angell called, so did Horace and Sophia. All my children gone to our Sunday school to the Easter festival. Mrs Angell gone tonight to New York. I went again tonight to see Belle. She better.

note top left:  Belle better 31   Monday March 29, 1875  note top right:  Mary Frances 30   This is a beautiful bright day. all of my family well. I went to my boys school to see their teacher. then to see Belle. she is suffering much with Neuralgia in her head. Mr Harvey took her to drive but it did not do her any good, she returned with worse pain. Octave came to see her so did Mr Nelson Mrs Cook and Miss Bruinard. Mrs & Miss Wheelock called to invite us to her house to a reading. Mr Cresas invited us to a reading tomorrow Miss Brainard, Miss Yager, called. I stayed with Belle until very late at night. Eva and Hunt went out riding. I received a letter from Pa.  Teusday March 30, 1875. This has been a beautiful day, I went down early to Belle's house and found her in a very desponding mood. feeling quite Sick had a bad night, and is suffering Severely with the pain on the top of her head. stayed all day with her, and today we are giving her Quinine, she is certainly no better. at six O,clock I returned home dressed myself and went with Mr Badger Ada and Sheridan to Mr Cresas's reading. met many of our old friends there. after the reading was over Mr Cresas had Cream Cakes & fruits brought around to us and after that Coffee was served. We had a charming evening. I engaged a new girl in Mary,s place named Mary Franz. she comes tomorrow. She is for second work. Wednesday March 31, 1875.  This has been a cloudy and rainy day all of us well at my house I went down to Belle's house at eight O,clock. found her better stayed with her all day. her did not return all day. the first time she has been free for four weeks. My new girl Mary came today. Thursday April 1st 1875 This has been a cold blustering day. I went to Belle,s house at eight O.clock, found her better but very weak. She is not up yet. Mrs Crocker called today. Miss Kyle here to make a dress of white Shallie for Ada. Mrs McKinelley left party cards for us today for next Teusday. Mrs & Miss Groverman and Mrs B Botsford called.  Friday April 2nd 1875 This has been a good day. all of my family well. Belle I sent to see early and found her not so well. she had her chill & fever come on again. I left at six and came home. the Literary club met here tonight Misses Wadsworth Miss Tuttle Mrs & Miss Dunlop called.

note top left:  Mrs Nicholson   Saturday April 3rd 1875  note top right:  Nanie Leiter  This has been a good day. all my family well. I went to Belle,s house early. found her better stayed with her untill six O.clock. then returned home. Mr C.P. Bryan came today to say good bye as he goes to Europe. last night our Club had a good time after it was over, all danced. Nanie Leiter sick. Mond  Sunday April 4th 1875. This has been a good day untill five O.clock when a North East wind blew up and there was a great change. I went to Belle's and stayed all day. She still complaining of her head. Eva was not well when I went at six  She sent for Dr Small's and then for me. I sent for Mrs Nicholson and she came Eva feeling very bad Nanie Leiter ill  Monday April 5th 1875  This has been a beautiful bright day but a little cool. all of my family well but Eva, she has taken cold in her bowels. and is compelled to keep bed, and sent for the Doctor, and I sent for Mrs Nicholson my old nurse. she came Sunday Afternoon and stayed with Eva untill one O.clock today. then she returned home. Eva feels better tonight. Mrs Dunlop called so did Miss Dunley. I went to see Belle and she is better but still has a pain in her head. Ada stayed with her in the afternoon and I came home to Eva and then went back again and stayed two hours  Tuesday April 6th 1875  This has been a beautiful day. all of my family well, but Eva, she still has her cold but feels better today. I went to see Belle at one O.clock and found her better at 12 O,clock I went with Maggie Robby and baby to Mr Bounds Gallery to have their Photographs taken, when I got back Belle had been writing a letter and her head got worse. Dr Small called in and told her to go out and drive I took her and rode up to my house and back again, when we got back. Mrs Crapser was at the house from Sandwich.  and Miss Kyle the dressmaker also. I returned home late and found Eva better. I sent my regret to Mrs McKindley,s party. and acceptance to Mrs Wilkinson,s lunch

Wednesday April 7, 1875 This has been a chilly day. I went to Belle,s house early, found Mrs Ceupher sitting with her I went with Maggie Rob and baby to Brands and had their pictures taken again. Then returned and found Catie Lunt with Belle, she had come to Lunch. Belle,s headache came on today and lasted three hours. I stayed late with Belle. Mrs Adams called tonight  Thursday April 8 1875  This morning is was sunny and warm. all of my family well. I arose early as we expected Mr Angell. but soon a dispatch from him said he was three hours behind, so he did not arrive untill ten O.clock. I said how do you do and then went to Belle's found her bright soon dressed her and got her up. at 12, she had a little headache, Mrs Borden called. and we had several April showers. returned home at six. Mrs Lam Wheeler called after supper. Mrs C.T. Boal called at my house.  Friday April 9 1875  This has been a bright day but cool. I went down early to Belle's found her bright but very short of breath sometimes faint, at three O.clock it got warmer and I took her to drive, and came up to our house, she enjoyed that but she did not get out, and we returned to her house again. She took a short nap and felt quite bright. I returned home at six. Ada and Hunt went out in my Carriage driving Mrs Blair called to see me to night to inquire about a servant named Mary.  Saturday April 10, 1875  This has been a bright day. all of my family well. I went to Belle's house early and spent the morning. found her feeling very bright. her Carriage came round and I took her and Minnie and the baby to drive, went to my house and she stayed untill four O.clock, then she returned home. Ada and I went in our Carriage to Mrs Wilkinson's to a lunch party we enjoyed it very much. I then went to Belle's and Mr Harvey brought me home. Ada has gone with Mrs Adams to Miss Mitchell's to a Club. it is now quite cold and the wind is high.

note top left:  Snow 13   Sunday April 11, 1875  New York note top right:  Belle 13.   It has rained all day, but I went in the Buggy to see Belle. found her feeling well. stayed with her untill 12 then I went back to my house and stayed with the family untill three. I then went back and stayed with Belle untill six. she has had no Neurulgia to day. and they talk of leaving for New York teusday. Hunt has been a little croupy to day.  Monday April 12, 1875  It has been raining all day and to night it is snowing. I went to Belle this morning and stayed untill 2 then came home for a few minutes, then went to Field and Leiters to buy some things for Belle, my boy Hunt has croup, and my serving girl Pauline is sick with cold. Belle packed to day and thinks she will go to New York to morrow.  Tuesday April 13, 1875  This is a bright sunny day. but snow on the ground and a fresh North Wind, yet the snow was so thin that it is melting away. My family all well but Hunt he coughed all night with croup. and to day is still coughing. I went to Belle's early and got her packed and her house set in order. and bought her a new sweet pretty hat. and a half past four Mrs Harvey came home and the Carriage came and Express Wagon and we all went to Depot to see her off. Mrs Crapser Mr Harvey,s sister arrived from Sandwich and will take care of Mrs Harvey,s house and three boys. I have Maggie Robby and the baby at my house with me. to stay untill they return. Mr Harvey,s Father will stay also at his house.  Wednesday April 14, 1875 The sun shone brightly to day. all our family well but Hunt. He has still the croup and coughs badly but is up and dressed. Ada out driving. Maggie Rob and baby have gone in their Carriage to drive, the baby is quite well. and enjoys our home.  Thursday April 15 1875  It has been all day snowing and raining. all of us well. My boy Hunt better of his cold. Maggie Rob and baby all have been out to ride. Eva and Ada have been also out to drive. after tea Mr Badger Ada Sheridan and myself all went to the Beethoven Society and enjoyed it very much. I expect Belle has arrived in New York this morning. Mrs Glover called

note top left:  Pauline 16  Friday April 16, 1875  It has been very cold all day. everything frozen all my family well but Hunt, he is still coughing very much but is better, Pauline has gone home sick with chills and fever. I went shopping to day with Eva, I received two letters one from Belle and the other from Mr Harvey. They were at Niagara. Belle is gaining strength fast, and is confident the trip will do her good. Ada gone with Miss Farnsworth to the Literary club of Mr Waters. which she belongs to.  Saturday April 17, 1875  This is a very cold day. all of us well, but Hunt whose cold is much better, Mrs Crapster came this morning and it was snowing fast. so baby did not go out. about eleven O, clock Belle's baby Belle Badger was taken very sick with fever sick stomach and severe cold. she acts as if her throat was sore. I sent for the Doctor. he did not come and I sent again and he came at seven O,clock and left her medicine, she is threatened with Pneumonia I expect we will have a bad night with her. Ada went this afternoon to a concert with the Misses Otis. Mrs Leiter came to day to see me. she sails on the second of June  Sunday April 18, 1875  It is beautiful and sunny to day. the weather has moderated some, all my family are well. Hunt almost free of his cough. Belle's baby is better this morning. but still with fever and cough. Ada and Shreve gone to church Mr Badger gone to his Father,s Eva and Mr Angell going to take a drive, Mrs Dibble has her first child a son four weeks old, all night last night Maggie and I were up with the baby, she could not rest an hour quiet  Monday April 19, 1875  This morning began sunny and beautiful. but at one O, clock the wind changed and a North wind sprang up. and it became cold and to night it is pouring rain, Hunt is coughing. very much, all the rest well  Dr Small came to see baby. she is threatened with Pneumonia I went to see Mrs Crapster at Mr Harvey,s then returned home, quite a storm of wind and rain has come up. I received a letter from Belle in New York she is feeling well. but not very strong, she is at the Windsor Hotel and enjoys it, her boys took supper with us.

Tuesday April 20, 1875 All last night we had a wind and rain storm the baby did not rest well. all of my family well. Hunt went to dinner to  day the first time for a week the sun shone brightly. but it is cold and rigid so ours seemed Mrs Gage Mrs Williams & Mrs Freeman called  Eva gone out riding baby feels better to day. Dr Small called to see her  Wednesday April 21, 1875  This has been a glorious bright sunny day. but wind blowing from the North East, and very cold. all of my family well, but baby Harvey is still stick with Pneumonia. Sometimes she almost suffocates I sent off early for Dr Small about seven O, clock and he visited her. again to night, and he thinks her a little better Miss Mattie Hill came to see Ada to day. Mr Taylor called to say good bye to Ada as he is going to Europe  Thursday April 22 1875  This is a lovely day. clear cool and sunny. all my family well. Eva has gone out to drive and has taken Hunt and Ruby with her, it is the first day Hunt has been out for ten days Belle,s baby has been all day much better. and laughs at every one she feels pretty well. Dr Small did not t come to day. Mrs Leonard and Mrs Boyce called so did Mrs Doggett Mr Adams called after tea, Ella Badger and her Father spent the day with me. he is my husband's Father.  Friday April 23, 1875  It was sunny and bright until 2 O, clock when it begun blowing and continues until Saturday unclear all my family are well, Belle,s baby don't feel quite so well, we had a dispatch saying Belle and husband would be here in the morning.  Saturday April 24th  This morning is sunny and beautiful . I arose early and got ready for Belle. they arrived at eight, they were thunderstruck to think their baby had Pneunmonia Belle looks well and strong so does Mr Hearney, she enjoyed her trip her baby not unclear Mr. Harvey would take his baby home so she was bundled up and taken home, I went down in the afternoon and she did not seem hurt by moving Sheridan

note top left:  Shreve flesh X   Sunday April 25 1875  note top right:  hats 28,   David 27   This had been a beautiful day, all of us well. Ada went to church, I went on the west side with Hunt and Mr Badger to Mrs Sam Walker. Then returned for Ada at Church I went to Belle,s after lunch with Mr Badger found the baby much improved. Mr Badger staid for supper. I returned home as our party had ice Cream for supper.   Monday April 26 1875  This has been a mild day, all of us well. I ordered the Carriage early. Mr. Faulds arrived from Louisville this morning.  after breakfast I went with Eva Ada &  Hunt to Mrs Hiltons to see the Circus procession, it passed at 10 o,clock and was very good. I went to see Belle. her baby better. Her George has a hand cut by a broken X bottle. My Shreve is losing flesh very fast, received Miss Kyle,s wedding cards Mrs Geo Pullman is quite sick  David Faulds took all of us to the Circus to night. Ada Sheridan Shreve Tom and myself went with him. George Milton & George Meeker went with us.  Tuesday April 27 1875  This has been a beautiful day, all of us well. I went visiting today on the west side took Ada and Hunt with me. Called to see Mrs McKinelly, Mrs Locke then on Mrs Wilkinson Mrs Kale. Mrs Futtall King Mrs Cook Mrs Mayo.  Mrs Dr Grosbeck. then called on Mrs Harvey.  found her out, her baby better. David Faulds went home to night to Louisville, this morning he took Tom Sheridan & Shreve with him and went to Evanston, they all enjoyed it, they called on Mrs. Lunt.  Wednesday April 28, 1875  This has been a very lovely day.  Warm and sunny.  all of us well  I went visiting all day.  with Ada, called on Mrs Dunling. Mrs Stone Mrs Carpenter Mrs Colby Mrs Hibbard Mrs Shortall Mrs Staples Mrs Gore Mrs Loomis Mrs Laynes Mrs Nelson Mrs Harden Mrs & Miss Goodwin Mrs White, Mrs W K. Brown and Mrs Cetus Brown, Mrs Taylor. Mrs Le Turner. Mrs Bigdour.  I called to see Mrs Leiter, her Nannie has had a cold.  Ada & Mr Badger gone to night to Thomas Concert, after tea Belle & Mr Harvey came up to see us.  I bought my boys new shoes and a new hatt,  Thursday April 29, 1875  It rained very severely all morning, but this afternoon it cleared off and is warm and sunny, all of us well.  So is Belle,s family.  My boys out in the Buggy.  Eva started out in the Carriage, but Tom started the horses too quick and tore off the door, so she had to get out

note top left:  Keen X   Friday April 30th 1875  This has been a beautiful sunny day.  all of us well  I sewed on Shreve,s pants, Eva gone to Belle,s to spend the afternoon.  Ada and I went calling.  went to see Mrs W K Turner Mrs  Kimbark, Mrs Thomasson, and Belle.  brought Eva home, after tea Mrs F Tuttle called so did Mrs Wiley Keen X  Maria Hamilton Keen has a baby a week old.  She married 7 months, to night there is a sharp North wind and it has turned cold.  Saturday May 1,st 1875  Snow +  This has been a funny day, all of us well.  it has been raining and at noon commenced to snow.  and has continued all day.  My boys are all at home making balls.  after dinner Ada Sheridan & Tom all went strikeout to hear or /to see the five pictures at the exhibition  I had Shreve,s hair cut very short, but it will soon grow out,  Sunday May 2nd 1875  This has been a lovely day all of us well.  I went to church with Ada Shreve and Thomas Shreve, then called to see Belle.  her baby well.  after dinner Belle & Mr Harvey came up to see Eva.  Mr Badger and myself went home with them to tea.  Mr Angell Eva and Hunt went out  Sheridan  driving, Gen Sheridan is to be married to Miss Rucker  Monday May 3rd  This has been a rainy day. all of my family well.  after lunch I went with Ada Eva and Mr Badger to see the beautiful paintings at the exposition building, we staid a long time  Ada was sketching some of Madame Hague, & flowers.  we then went to Kosson Milliner and Field & Leiters  it still rains.  Tuesday May 4th 1875  This has been a bright day but cool.  Went out riding all of us well.  Ada & I made several calls, called on Mrs Colby, Mrs Davis & Farlies, Hoyne, & then went to see Belle  she and her family all right, Belle and her baby came to see us  Mr Nichol also called to see strikeout Eva, Pauline Gabler Hunts old Nurse came to say good bye as she will sail for Europe in a few days to return to her Mother, as she is sick.

Wednesday May 5th 1875 I has rained all morning and turning quite cool all of my family are well. so is my daughter, Belle's family after lunch I ordered the Carriage and went to Belle,s then to Field & Leiter  Thursday May 6th 1875 This has been a mild day. Part of the time the sun shone and part of the time It rained, all of our family well. Mrs F.O. Burten spent the morning with me. Mrs C, Hensatin Miss Martin and Miss Foote called to see me. I am having my lace Curtains done up at home. Mr Harvey and Belle came up and took tea with us. Mrs Larned had her first reception to day since her marriage Friday May 7, 1875 This has been a very beautiful day. all of my family well Ada and I went calling. went to see on the North Aide Mrs Ogden, Mrs McHay, Mrs Hugh Adams Mrs Chapman Mrs Dr Heydock Mrs Larnard Mrs Alonzo Rawdon, Mr Burton and bride Mrs Burton Mrs Holmes and Mrs Sherman, Mrs Obadiah Jackson  Eva went in the Buggy for Mr Badger, or Mr Angell.  Mrs Leiter sent a Eva a fruit basket of Bananas Pa wrote me a nice letter. Mr Fred Grant called to see us with his  Saturday May 8, 1875  This has been a very warm day. but the wind is very high, all of us well, Belle called with her beautiful baby and stayed awhile. she is fat and well. I called to day with Ada on Mrs Mitchell Mrs Crawford and Belle, after tea I went out to Mrs Leiters and stayed a while  Sunday May 9th 1875  It has rained almost all the day. I went to church with Ada Sheridan and Shreve, Mr Badger went out to his fathers. all of my family well.  after our dinner Mr Badger and I went to Belle,s house and spent the evening Belle sent her carriage up for Mr Badger Hunt and myself as it was raining, we enjoyed the evening and they sent us home in their Carriage. Belle's baby in left margin: Gen Sheridan married not very well to day.  Gen Sheridan to be married to Miss Rucker in June. Miss Otis and Mr Coundelman engaged.

note top left:  May 11 sick  Monday May 10th 1875  note top right:  Belle Louisville May 14   It is a lovely day, all of us well, all morning I have been pinning Lace Curtains after lunch Ada and I went calling. I went to see Mrs Pullman Mrs and Miss Gardner, Mrs H Thompson Mrs Filch, Mrs Edwin Gillette, after Tea Mrs Kent called. I sent my baby,s crib that all my children used to baby Harvey to use  strikeout: Mond Tuesday May 11th  All night I felt sick and to day I have been compelled to keep bed all day. from a Mishap, Ada  and Hunt went out in the Carriage and a severe hail storm came up and they were in the whole of it but all went right George Meeker called to night  Wednesday May 12th  This is a lovely day, all well but me I  am in bed, the great Home,s Circus came to day, and the great Reunion of the Army arrived in our City and Cannon and great demonstrations is going on Belle came up with her baby in elegant new white embroidered cloak she looked pretty Florence Hilton came to see Ada so did Miss Farnsworth to say good bye, she leaves for Europe. Mrs H Walker came to invite Ada to the party at Mrs Crawfords to night to she enjoyed it very much  Thursday May 13th, 1875  This was a beautiful sunny morning, all well with us, I am up and feel much improved, at nine O, clock Ada enjoyed Mrs Crawfrod;s party last night very much, so did Mr. Badger. Ada this morning ordered the Carriage at nine and went to the Exposition building with Mr Henry Walker to see the Flag presentation, Belle came up and took Eva and Hunt and went to Mr Angells office to see the soldiers view, it rained at one O, clock Friday May 14th, 1875 this has been a cold cloudy day. the soldiers are to parade and contest for a flag. we are all well. I went in the carriage with Eva Ada and Hunt down to see it, returned home and packed my trunk and started with Belle for Louisville X

note top left:  + Charleton Staples Badger born May 18   Saturday May 15, 1875  This has been a sunny day but very cold. I had my trunk with one all ready at the Depot last night to go with Belle to Louisville, and then gave it up on Eva's account as she don't feel well, Belle went with her baby Belle George Robby and Maggie. Mr Harvey could not go. I was so sorry to give up the journey. Mr Badger went this afternoon to the Home,s Circus with Ada and Hunt. They enjoyed it. Party ticket came to day for Mrs Doggetts party next week  Sunday May 16, 1875  This has been a lovely day, but cold, all of us well. I went to church with Ada and Shreve, but the church was so cold that I came out and went to Mrs Hiltons and stayed awhile then went to Mr Harvey,s and saw John he is better. Dr Small called to see Eva she had some cold, Mrs Nelson came to see Eva and will come to her if necessity calls her. she is now at Mrs Stone,s  Mr Harry came up to see me to night Monday May 17, 1875  This has been a beautiful day. all of us well, Ada gone to buy some natural flowers. Shreve bought a X new pair of pants, Sheridan gone to buy a musket.  to night Mr Badger, Ada and myself all went to a party at Mrs Doggetts it was a Musical given to Mr Wolfsohn the Pianist, Miss Heiskill sang, after we had refreshments  Tuesday May 18, 1875  This has been another lovely day cool but sunny all of us well. all morning we remained at home, but at two O, clock I ordered my Carriage and went visiting called on Mrs Crawford Mrs Kreigh Mrs Egan Mrs Sam Walker and Mother inlaw Badger. to our surprise when we got there they told us that Sophia had a son, he was born at seven O,clock this morning, he is named Charleton + Staples Badger. weighs six pounds. all doing well. Ella Badger came out also to tell us. Mr Harvey came up after supper. he wants Ada to go with him to morrow night to Louisville they are having a nice time with parties in Louisville, Belle writes all are very gay.

Wednesay May 19 1875 This has been a lovely day. all of us well. Ada note left margin:  Ada + Louisville to night getting ready for Louisville, Mrs and Miss Larned called today, so did Mrs Leiter, to get me to witness her will, at four O, clock I went with Ada to Mr Harvey,s and helped him to pack he has Mr Clark to stay at his house while he is away so at six O,clock we went in our Carriage to the Depot with Ada and in a note left margin:  Mrs Leiter,s will + few minutes Mr Harvey and her left for Louisville, we returned home and got Hunt and went to Parnell Hall to a concert given by the Apollo Club. Mr Wiley called tonight Thursday May 20th 1975  This morning was beautiful, but this afternoon it rained, all of us in health. Miss Kyle called for her bill of 17 dollars for Ada,s dress. she says note left margin:  Ellen X Ellen Scanlon has a Son two weeks old, my boys busy as can be getting up a Company. they have bought their Muskets, and Mr Angell is their captain  Eva and Mr Angell gone driving, after ten Mr Badger went down town, I received a letter from Belle and one from my sister Belle.  Friday May 21st 1875  This morning was fair but after lunch it rained note left margin:  Mrs H.C. Stone a Son, 20, all of us well. Mrs Aldrich called to see me Eva sent for Dr Small, she has cold, Mrs HO Stone has a son one day old. Mrs Aldersham called to see Ada, so did Mrs F Allport.  after tea Mr Badger and I went to a concert given to Miss Jessica Haskell, who is a good singer, she leaves in note left margin:  Mrs Leiter ticket a few days for Europe, she improve her voice. Mr Leiter sent me tickets as a present  Saturday May 22nd 1875  To day has been very unpleasant, the fog has been very thick and the air cold, all of our family well. Mr Hunt of Louisville arrived this morning. I went down street with Hunt in my Carriage Called at Field & Leiters, then on Mrs Stone she very comfortable, her boy 17 months old they think will die of brain disease, I then called to see Mrs Leiter Mrs Marshall Field returned from Europe. a few days ago.

note top left:  Hannah Olsen X May 25  Sunday May 23rd 1875 note top right:  Belle arrived X   This has been a queer day. Foggy and sun and rain and a North East wind, very changeable we are all well, I went to church with Sheridan and Thomas Shreve, after church stopped at the Harveys and inquired after the children, found all well then went to Mrs Stone,s to ask after her sick child note left margin: Hoyt Stone and learned he was dying, at about the time he died from a fall on his head, he was 14 months old, and her new baby is only three days old. Mrs Gen Drew has a daughter born at 11, O,clock this note left margin: Gen Drew morning. at five O,clock I driving with Edward Mr Angell, took Hunt with me. Mrs Badger and Shreve gone out to his Father,s. Mrs Hunt came to see me to day. he leaves from Louisville to night note left margin: Hunt Mr Badger all morning out with Mrs Hunt driving.  Monday May 24 1875  This has been a lovely day, all of us well, I went with early to get a seamstress. I will try note left margin: Hannah Olsen and see if she can work well. I went with Miss Yager to get some flowers for Mrs Stone,s baby. then returned and took lunch. then went out with Hunt to Father Badger,s to see Horace,s new baby. My Sheridan & shreve are to be pall bearers for Mrs Stone,s baby.  Dr Small came to see Eva, she has a cold. Mrs Hugh Adams note left margin: Gillette and Miss Adams called to day. Mr Badger and I are invited to Mrs Gillette to a tea party on Thursday. Mr Hunt went to Louisville last night. Tuesday May 25, 1875  This has been a beautiful day but cool. all of us note left margin: Stone buried well. at ten O,clock I went to the funeral of Mrs Stone's baby Hoyt, 17 months old. died from a fall. Sheridan and Shreve were pall bearers,  note left margin: Belle arrived + I went down town and found that Belle had arrived with her three children her baby has been sick with cold. Ada stayed in Louisville Mrs James Morton came to see me. so did Alice Hilton, I went over and stayed awhile with Mrs Leiter, after lunch I went with Hunt and took dinner with Belle. my new girl came to day.

Wednesday May 26, 1875 This has been a lovely day. all of us well I received a dispatch from Ada that she would not be here in the morning. I went to see Belle found her out at Miss Bruinwels Concert. I met Mrs Rand at Belle,s house. Mrs Harvey and note left margin: Duretta May 27 Belle came up after supper to see us, I went out driving with Eva to day, she not well, Duretta who was so ill with Dropsy. was at Belle,s quite well. Thursday May 27, 1875 This has been a lovely day. all of us well. Belle came up and brought her baby. they are quite well, they think of keeping Duretta at their home to live with them. Mr & Mrs Leiter left at five note left margin: Mrs Leiter X  for New York, and sail for Europe in a few days she took her three children with her and Mrs blank as Nurse. they will be gone many months Dr Locke called to see me, so did Mrs Edson Keith, at seven O,clock we had sharp shower and at half past seven Mr Badger and I went to the Matteson House to a tea party given by note left margin: Mrs Jillette Mrs Jillette, who leaves for Europe in June Mrs Chas J Haines called  Friday May 28th, 1875  This morning was sunny but windy, all of us note left margin: Belle had) years married well, this is the Anniversary of Belle,s wedding just two years, this afternoon a very sharp storm of rain came up and prevented me going to Belle,s note left margin: my Mother very ill house, news from Louisville to night say Mother is still ill, so I have telegraphed at once Ada is in Louisville, my Eva not at all well. Saturday May 29, 1875 This has been a beautiful sunny day. all of note left margin: dispatch Ma better us well, but Eva, she is very uncomfortable A dispatch from my home in Louisville says that Ma is better and Ada and Mattie will leave to day for Chicago, I ordered my Carriage and went to see Belle, took her with me to do some shopping Miss Bickford called to see Ada.

note top left & down margin:  Louisville  X Ada and Mattie) came at Seven this morning) X   Sunday May 30, 1875  note top right:  June 2 twins  This has been a lovely day.  all of us well.  I got up at six and ordered the Carriage and went to the Kokomo Depot with Octave and Hunt. met Mr Harvey and Belle in their Carriage, all going to receive Ada and Mattie Faulds from Louisville. they arrived on time both fat and well.  my Mother much better I then went to church with Ada, Mr Badger and the boys went out to his Father,s.  after lunch Belle Mr Harvey Mattie and Octave all came up to spend the afternoon  Mr Badger and I went back with them to supper.  Monday May 31 1875  This has been a bright day, all of us well  I have concluded to give up my Norwegian girl as she dont seem nice enough. her name is note left margin: Olsen + Hannah Olsen.  after lunch Ada Hunt & myself all went to the different places to find a new girl and then went shopping.  Mr Harvey and Belle came up after tea.  note left margin: Evanston)  Belle and Mattie spent the day in Evanston with Mrs Horace Lunt.  Tuesday June 1st 1875  It has poured rain with Thunder and Lightning all day.  all of us well but Eva she has taken cold and has fever and pains. and been compelled to go up to her room, so I followed her and remained with her.  note left margin: Choral Hannah she cannot sleep and Dr Small has ordered Chloral for her to night, my Hannah went away to day to be a Nurse.  note left margin: X birth of) twins) Wednesday June 2nd 1875  This has been a variable day.  all of us well. this afternoon it rained, Eva dont feel well.  so she has gone to her room, I went up and stayed all afternoon with her, she took her powder and at 12 in the night note left margin: Eva gone she called for me. I went up and labor had begun but worked very slowly, she suffering all night. + sent for Dr Small and Mrs Nelson.  at one O,clock in the night or morning, a little daughter was born weighing 8 pound, and the Doctor announced another and at three sure enough another little girl was born weighing eight pound X

Thursday June 3rd 1875. note top right:  Eva, death.   We were up all night and this morning. Eva became quite exhausted and continued so until five o,clock and then her beautiful life went out, much to the surprise of Doctor note left margin:  Eva died, June 3rd and the nurses. It is a fearful thunderball to all of us, as she continued so well for so long a time. Catie Lunt had a son born at the same time. It is a severe blow to us all, and crowds of friends have flocked to us. Eva leaves two beautiful babes. Mrs. Nicholson and Lena will have to take care of them. Tomorrow my sisters arrive. Words cannot describe our loss. My beautiful Eva is gone, she was a christian child from her early youth. Always beautiful in her character as a daughter, as a sister, and a friend. Truly we are sorely afflicted and the whole community seems to feel it. We will miss her merry laugh everywhere. Always patient, confiding and loving. Her brothers and sisters will long mourn her loss. She was too good to live.  Friday June 4th 1875.  Last night Mrs. Fitch took care of my darling Eva. My sisters arrived this morning at seven o'clock. Mr & Mrs. Faulds and Mrs. Shreve, they are much grieved. Mrs. Hilton, my husband's Sister is taking care of our house and friends, and Mr. Will Angell is attending to everything outside. My sisters brought beautiful flowers with them for my precious Eva. Mr. Lucius Sherman sent a basket of flowers. The babies are doing well, we have put them on the bottle. They are beautiful babies and weigh eight pounds a piece. It is no wonder that their poor young mother had to give up her life. Oh how my heart bleeds.  Saturday June 5th 1875.  This has been a chilly damp day. All of us well, but Hunt. He is coughing. A great many baskets of flowers have been sent in to my dear departed Eva. Her friends are mourning her loss deeply and letters of sympathy are coming in all the time. And tomorrow I expect we will have a great many more. It will be a very sad day to us, one that will make our hearts ache, truly we are afflicted.

Sunday June 6th 1875  note left margin X Evas death This has been cloudy -- day -- but no rain.  all of us well we rose early as it was to be a sore sad day to us all  this is the day that we are to lay away our precious beautiful child Eva in the cold ground, her death has caused a great panic among our friends, and hearts are bleeding all over the city for us in our sad bereavement.  truly we need their sympathy for we have lost one too beautiful, too good to live  at an early hour Mrs Hilton and Mr Wm Angell came to our house to arrange the flowers.  We had crosses. Stars, wreaths, baskets, Anchor,s, harps and cut flowers sent in by kind friends in great profusion, every peice of very large size and one large broken column, there were all beautiful in their design,s.  at one O, clock the company began to assemble and soon the house, hall, and streets were crowded with our friends, then we all put on our hats and sat up stairs in the hall to hear the services.  poor Mr Angell was brought in from Mr Harvey,s and he looks like death, and there is fear of his reason leaving him, he is ill, his heart seems broke.  there was four voices who sang three beautiful hymns.  I know that my Reedemer liveth, Just as I am,   and when the coffin was carried out they sang Nearer my God to thee.  it was very affecting, we went down with all our family and relatives, and Mr Badger Mr Angell and myself in one Carriage and our immediate family in the rest, our Carriages numbered fifty  Mr Angell became a little composed with us. but when we arrived at the grave Mr Harvey had the grave covered with flowers and when the Casket was lowered, it looked like in a garden, poor Mr Angell knelt at the grave like one lost, it made ones heart ache.  after the services they sang, Abide with me.  and then we returned home sad and lonely leaving our hearts treasure behind us.  her merry laugh never to be heard again on earth her two little babes never knew their Mother,s love or saw her beautiful face.

Monday June 7th 1875  This has been a lovely day. clear and beautiful  all of us well.  Mr Angell came up to breakfast with us. and stayed untill 12, then he and Mr Harvey went out to Graceland to be with Eva.  at five O, clock Dr Kelly and Dr Locke came to note left margin:  Christening baptise the babies, Mr Wm Angell and Mr George Pullman, Mr Hilton and Father Badger and Ella all came to the Christening.  Mr Angell thought it best to have it done, while Mr Shreve and Mr & Mrs Faulds, and Mattie were here, so the service was at five, and the oldest twin was named Ada Badger and the one three hours younger called Belle Badger.  it was sad to see the dear little ones without a Mother.  My little Grandbaby Belle Harvey was present. at seven O, clock my two Sisters and Mr Faulds returned back to Louisville, they came up to attend Eva,s funeral  letters of Sympathy still continue to come, hearts bleed for us everywhere,  Tuesday June 8th 1875  This has been a lovely day.  all of us well.  I only wish my heart was as happy as it has been for twenty or more years.  my I am sad and broken, hearted,  I try to eat, but my heart is sick.  I have been so happy that I am afraid I was not grateful enough.  My beautiful good Eva is gone. and the music of our house is hushed, my poor children who are left feel sad and lonely.  my poor Belle & Ada my heart goes out now to them.  my three boys are so full of life that they cant Sorrow,   May they never feel what I now feel. is my prayer.  Oh, if my beautiful Eva was here, all would be well.  but her sweet voice is hushed, never more to be heard on earth  her dear little twins are doing well.  I went at note left margin:  Cemetary three O, clock to Graceland to see poor Eva s grave with Mr Badger Sheridan Shreve Tom, Ada and Hunt.  Belle soon came in her Carriage so did Mr Angell.  Belle,s baby has cold. and she is not well.  letters of Sympathy still come.

Wednesday June 9th 1875  This has been a damp rainy day.  all of us well.  Mattie Faulds spent the morning with Belle, her baby has a bad choking cough.  but dont seem sick.  note left margin:  Nursery + we commenced to day to take up Carpet and to paint our Nursery to give it up to Eva,s twins.  they keep well and strong.  Mrs Nelson came to see me.  we still receive letters of Sympathy from our friends. Oh! it seems to me to grow worse, my heart is so faint and sick, and I feel the sad loss of my dear Eva more and more.  Thursday June 10th 1875  This has been a beautiful day.  all of us well.  Mattie & Hunt gone to see Belle,  Mrs Hilton and Mr Wm Angell, here to day.  fixing up the Nursery with new Carpet Curtains & paint. for the twin babies,  Belle & Mother Harvey came up to see the babies Mrs Thompson came also to see the children, so did Mrs Luther Shreve,  after lunch Mattie Faulds and Hunt with Ada went out to get some air, George Meeker had his Nose broken to day by a Base ball, Mr Angell came up to Supper,  Friday June 11th 1875  To day has been sultry and windy, and looks like rain, all of us well, and babies doing well if I could only feel happy as I have done for so many years.  I should be so glad, it seems to me, that I would never murmur again at anything if I only had my Eva by my side, how sad, how stark, how, dreary everything seems.  and yet I must not complain, but pray for strength  I feel so ill in my heart.  I have sent Ada [note left margin:  Chains Pullman]]  to drive with my Hunt and Mattie Faulds to get the air, Mr Angell came up to supper.  he talks of going out of the City for a few days.  Mrs G.M. Pullman sent the twin Angell beautiful chains & lockets.  Mrs Henry King came to inquire after the babies & myself.  I went up stairs to night for the first time to see the babies since their birth, my heart has been too full to go up before.  Mr & Mrs Harvey and baby came up to see us to day.

Saturday June 12th 1875  Another day gone, and still no Eva has returned to our weeping hearts, she is really gone away from us never to return, and we must weep and Mourn alone  it has turned very cold to day like winter. all of us well. Belle with her beautiful baby has been up to see us. They are quite well. Catie Isaacs is still very feeble and it will take sometime to get her up. it is her tenth day. her baby boy is all right. she don't know yet that our darling Eva is no more, Oh what fearful words, no more. it seems as if my heart must break. I have sent Ada Mattie Faulds and Hunt out to get the air. My boy Shreve had quite a faint turn at lunch from being overheated and cooling off too fast.  Sunday June 13th 1875  It is still cold, very cold, we have started the steam through the house. last night we were all sick, every one in the house with Cramp and Diarrhea, to day we are better, babies seem all right, we think of going to day to Graceland to be with our darling Eva for awhile past Sunday she lay in this house in her casket and was buried at two O, clock and to day we are alone. Oh! Memory you have almost left me. I am so heart sick and broken hearted, none of us have gone to church to day. Mr Angell still stopping at Belle,s house.  Monday June 14th 1875  note left margin: Painting It has been cloudy and chilly to day, all of us well. the Painters commenced their work in our nursery to day and it looks very pretty. the wall will be French grey and blue border. we are trying to make things pretty and comfortable for Eva,s babies, Mrs Nicholson the Monthly Nurse and Lena Eva,s french maid are caring for the children, I am so glad we have them, poor dear children left all alone in this cold world without any Mother. it does seem to me as if I would lose my reason when I think that my lovely and beautiful child has been taken away from us. I wish I could forget the past, but memory seems strong. Mr & Mrs Harvey and Mrs Angell came up after dinner and sat with us. it now raind hard a letter came from Mattie Sheridan, she knows nothing about our trouble, Mrs Logan wrote me.

Tuesday June 15,1875  This has been a bad day, raining very often and chilly, all of us well. the painters, plumbers and Carpet Shakers all have been to work to day at two of our rooms. and we are in great confusion, and I fear Painting will be so for sometime. Ada and Mattie went riding and called to see Belle. found all well. Mrs Locke sent Mr Angell a beautiful book, title Gone before and sent me a note. I had letter from home and also one from Mr Charles Johnson, Miss Markly sent her wedding Cards to us to day. Our boys invited to a party at Mr Kelly,s my Sisters all have sent letters full of love and sympathy. our loss is keenly felt by them, they were so proud of Eva, and have such an extravagant admiration for her, she was so lovely that she inspired all, it is a public calamity both here and in Louisville, how feeble we are now in our great loss. utter desolation reigns in our house, the merry musical laugh is hushed, and we are sad and broken hearted.  Wednesday June 16th 1875.  This morning was very foggy but this afternoon it cleared up and was quite warm, all of my family well. letters from home say that my Father & Mother are feeble, but not sick, they grieve my dear Eva,s death, well they may, the whole City Mourns, Mrs Bowling sent a letter of sympathy. besides a large number of other fruits. Ada Mattie Faulds and Hunt went out for the air. Belle,s baby came up to see me, after dinner Belle walked up with Father Harry and her husband. Mr Angell was up to dinner. our painters plumbers and gas men are here still at work. I feel to day very blue, and sad, sad, sad,  Thursday June 17 1875  This has been a bright day but a cool one, all of us well, Belle & baby came up and spent the morning with me, Mattie Ada and Hunt I sent out for air, Mrs & Miss Allport called, so did Mrs W. H. Brown and Florence Hilton, more letters have come from friends to us in our berevement we need them all, for we have been sorely afflicted.

Friday June 18. 1875.  To day has been very cool, but clear & sunny all of us well, Belle came up early and spent note left margin:  Neuralgia X  the morning with us, she had some of her old Neuralgia come on her to day in her face. after lunch Mattie Octave Ada & Hunt all went over to the West Side Park to get the air it is called Central Park. Mrs Nelson Billy & old Nurse came to see the babies. to night Mr Harvey brought me up a nice peice of Lemon Pie, he had been out to the stock yards to buy a good cow for Mr Angell,s babies, he has a nice one offered to him at 70 dollars. the babies are doing very well. an Englishman came to day to take our coachmans place, his name is Thomas Bryant Butcher.  Saturday June 19th 1875  It is clear cool and sunny. all of us well. Our Painters still at work, Mattie Belle and Ada went with her baby to get a Photograph of the baby, all them went to ride. Mr Angell came by to see us to night, the twin babies seem quite well,  we have our new Cow to night Belle,s baby came to see me for a little while.  Sunday June 20th 1875  This has been a beautiful warm sunny day. all of us well. Ada Mattie Faulds Tommy and Shreve all went to church, so did Mrs Angell. I did not go, after dinner Mr Angell and I went out to Graceland to Eva's grave, it looks very beautiful with flowers. Belle and Mr Harvey came out in their buggy and stayed awhile with us. the grounds in the lot of Mr Harvey,s are very beautiful, and my precious Eva has a lovely resting place, we will soon bring on her little sister May and bury her in the same lot.  Monday June 21st 1875  This has been a rainy day. all of us well. Ada Mattie Faulds gone to Mr Gollmans to sit for him, he wants Ada s hair to copy from for Eva,s, Belle ad Mr Harvey came up to dinner with us. Belle talks of going to Evanston to see Catie, Mr Angell wants to go to Louisville with him tomorrow

Tuesday June 22nd 1875  This has been a clear day but a little cool.  all of us well,  Our painters & plumbers still at work  we talk of going to Louisville to night, Hunt and myself with Mr Angell.  Our Tom has had a quarrel with note left margin:  Butcher X  Mary Franz our german girl and so he wants to quit, we will have a new man named Thomas B Butcher. Ada has been to Mr Gollmans again to sit for the Portrait of our darling lost Eva, Oh, it seems so hard to have lost one so full of life and health, it is so sad,  Wednesday June 23rd 1875  note left margin:  Louisville  We left last night at eight O. clock. for Louisville  all my children went to the Depot with me, we travelled along very quietly had a nice Drawing room, and went to bed, at four O. clock we arose and changed Cars at Indianapolis, it is a lovely morning and we did not go to bed again although we had our nice rooms,  we took a cup of Coffee and a Sandwich at the Depot, we reached Louisville at eight O clock, was met at the Depot by David Sister Belle, Mattie Belle Adele and James, found all well but my Mother  she sick in bed with Cold and pain in her stomach. they were all glad to see us,  we spent the morning at home, and in the Afternoon went with my Sister and Mr Angell to Cave Hill Cemetery, and looked at many Graves,  Mrs Sallie Ward Hunt called and sent me her sincere Sympathy.  Thursday June 24 1875  Another very hot day -- neither Hunt nor I could sleep  I remained home all day, my Mother better,  Hunt and Adele swing all the time, Mr Angell has gone to have his whiskers shaved off  he and David have gone to look after Memorial Windows, Col Nunes is writing a peic of Poetry about Eva, Mr Ross and Mr Angell and David are making all their preperations to have my baby Mary Virginia brought up to Chicago  Rev Cruik called to see me.  so did Mrs  X Bolling.  it is raining.

note top left:  Mary Virginia X   Friday June 25th 1875  I have not felt anything like the heat since I left Louisville, Hunt could not sleep. Mr Angell had nightmare.  all of us well.  My Mother is better and is up and dressed.  note left margin: Mrs Pullman Twins, boys June 25  A dispatch from strikeout:  Louisville  Chicago says that Mrs Geo, Pullman had twin boys to day weighing eight and nine pound a peice.  She and babies doing well.  It is so strange that both Mrs Angell and Mrs Pullman should have presented to them twins.  my very dear darling child gave up her life for hers.  Saturday June 26th 1875.  It has poured rain all day.  all of us well  My Mother better and up.  it is still very hot.  my dear baby Mary Virginia has been taken up to day and her iron Casket put in a new box and wonderful to tell her face and form is in perfect preservation. I have not been out to day.  but Mr Angell had.  James Faulds is all ready to go home with us, at eight we left our old home and said Good Bye to all, Jamie is with us, we travelled along in our State room untill twelve O. clock at night when we changed Cars, we met Melville Wendell at the Depot,  he has been to Louisville, it still pours rain, out little Casket was carried up in our Carriage  Sunday June 27, 1875  [note left margin:  Louisville X ]] It still rains, we rose in the Car at seven O. clock  was a little behind time,   did not arrive untill eight  met at the Cars, Mr Badger, Shreve, Ada, Mattie Faulds and Tommy Shreve, found all our family well.  all of us walked up to our house, but Mr Angell note left margin:  Mary Virginia dead X laid in our parlour  and Mr Badger, they came up to our house in our Carriage with the remains of Mary Virginia our little baby who died nineteen years ago.  had her Casket placed in the parlour  sent for Dr Locke to say prayers and Mrs Hilton Mr Badger & Sister, at two O. clock Mr Harvey and Belle and Mr Badger went out first to have her grave dug. by Eva

Sunday June 27, 1875  At two O. clock Dr Locke read the service over my beautiful little babe, who was buried 19 years ago note left margin:  Mary Vitginia  in Cave Hill, she would be twenty if she had lived.  we went out with three Carriages to Graceland had her buried very near Eva, it is sweet comfort to feel that my precious Eva has her dear little Sister so near her, we placed white flowers on her grave.  peace be to my dear children, may our Heavenly Father take them to his loving care, is the prayer of their heart broken Mother,  we returned home in the pouring rain Jamie went down to Belle,s house.  Monday June 28, 1875  This has been a bright day.  but cool, all of us well,  William the Carpenter is fixing the door of the Nursery.  Ada and Mattie gone to see Belle, James came up to see me.  Dr Thoms has gone to Belle,s house to dinner, he called on us to day.  Mrs Andrews and her daughter Lucy, came to day to see us.  Belle,s baby has cold again,  Mrs Pullman is getting quite well, we are going to put a new Carpet on Mr Angell room, my boys have no more school  Tuesday June 29th 1875.  To day has been beautiful and bright, all of us well, Dr Thoms called to see us, he talks of going to Louisville to night, to note left margin:  Dr Thoms  see Mrs Shreve, he is desperately in love with her.  Belle Jamie, and baby Harvey came up and spent the morning. Mr Angell spent the day at home to day.  as the men with note left margin:  baby Harvey whooping cough June 24 + 29  his Carpet and the Upholsterer were busy here all day.  the dear babies quite well.  Mattie gone to see Horace,s wife and baby.  Catie Lunt and her baby is also well. Mrs Stone and her baby and Mrs Pullman and her twins also well, all all well but my dear Eva, she gone note left margin:  "gone" never to return.  away from us forever.  after tea I went down with Mr Angell Mr Badger and Ada to see Belle, her baby and Robby have bad colds.  very much like whooping cough,  Wednesday June 30th 1875  This has been a beautiful day.  all of us well, but house still full of workmen, Mrs Hilton called to see me.  Mattie & Ada gone in Carriage to see Belle, her baby has cold, this is four weeks to day that the little Angells were born, Oh cruel fate to deprive me of my dear Eva  I had a letter from Mrs Leiter in London, she arrived safe.  X

Thursday July 1st 1875.  note top right:  Twins down stairs X   It has been damp and rainy all day.  all of us well, the Upholsterers will finish our work to morrow,  Mrs Hilton called to see us.  Jamie came up and spent the day with us.  He is staying with Belle.  I am trying to have our house set in order as it has been all upset by workmen,  Mrs Henry Keep and Mrs Peck called to see me,  Mrs Barter spent a day here when I was in Louisville.  Friday July 2nd 1875  This has been a damp day.  all of us well, I have had all my pictures hung up and every thing put in order.  in Mr Angell, s room and mine, also in the babies.  Mrs Stiles Burton & Mrs L. Grand Burton called to day.  our workmen left to night, Mrs Wiley called to night. after supper Mr Angell and I went down to see Mrs note left margin:  whooping Cough X  Harvey.  her two children Robby and baby Belle have the whooping Cough.  Ada gone again to sit for Eva,s picture, for the Hair and lace.  James Faulds had to come to my house to stay on account of the whooping cough.  he has not had note left margin: James +  it, we fear Eva,s dear little babies may take it as baby Harvey was with them.  Saturday July 3rd 1875.  It has again been very damp, all of us well.  we have been busy changing furniture in our ]]note left margin: X The twins ]] rooms, and at 12, O clock, I had Mrs Nicholson and Lena bring down the twins into their new Nursery.  they are doing well and gaining flesh.  the oldest is a little heavier than the other, she weights 9 1/2 pounds and the other weighs 9.  note left margin: X Poetry  a large package of papers came from David to day with a piece of Poetry about Eva composed by Col Nunes, it is very pretty.  Mrs Potter Palmer called to day.  The twins are well and pretty.  Sunday July 4th 1875  It has been very warm and raining, at noon there was a very severe peel of Thunder and Lightning, Ada and James went to church,  I had a headache and did not go.  at four O.clock note left margin: X Eva,s grave  Mr Angell and I went out to my darling Eva,s grave, it looks beautiful and is one large bed of flowers, it looks beautiful  X  we stopped at Belle,s her two children sick with whooping cough.  John Harvey cut his foot with his Bayonet, and is quite sick

Monday July 5th 1875. Today has been clear and sunny, and quite cool.  all of us well, it has been generally celebrated all over the City.  My boys have had their pistols and powder all day.  Sheridan and Tom Shreve went out in our buggy and took their rifle, Sheridan shot three birds on the wing, he is a good marksman.  Mr Angell and Mr Harvey went out in the Country to buy a Cow, as ours is not good.  Mr Badger at home playing with Hunt.  after lunch I went to Belle,s and stayed all evening, Belle not very well  her baby & Robby have whooping cough very badly.  John is a little better.  Mr Angell came for me.  X  Tuesday July 6th 1875 It has been a little cloudy all day.  at nine O. clock, my note left margin:  Riverside  two boys Sheridan and Shreve with Tom Shreve went out to riverside and spent the day.  they returned home all note left margin:  Photograph babies  right.  at ten the Photographer came to take the little Angell,s pictures  they five weeks old to morrow.  he has succeeded but we have not had the proofs.  we bought a new Cow from Mrs Dunne and gave our new Cow and Calf with fifty dollars to boot.  it is high but we must have good milk for the babies, as they will be raised by bottle.  Ada and Mattie Faulds spent the day with Grandpa Badger.  I went to see Belle,s baby after our supper.  she very unwell, all the rest better.  Wednesday July 7th 1875  note left margin:  Angells five weeks old to day.
