This has been a beautiful day.  all of us well, at nine  X  O, clock Belle sent for me to come down as her baby was very sick.  Mr Badger Mattie Faulds and myself all went down, the baby had got over her bad attack which frightened Belle, but she is a very sick baby with whooping Cough bad bowels fever and sore mouth also teething, I stayed all day with Belle.  John sat  X note left margin: John   up to day, I returned home and then went back to see how they did for the night  Thursday July 8th 1875  note left margin: baby Angell sick  X  This has been a lovely day.  all of us well, but the youngest baby Angell  she has high fever, sent for the Doctor, he came and said it was cold  I went to see Belle, her baby a little better, she and baby going out to drive, Mr Badger Ada, James, Mattie Sheridan Shreve Tom Shreve and Hunt all went to Riverside, and returned at five.

Thursday July 8th 1875  To day Mrs Mc Kay, Mrs Alrich, Mrs A. B. Pullman and daughters, Mrs Rothback Miss Foote, Miss F. Hilton Mrs and note left margin: baby Angell Ill.   Miss Cox, Mr & Mrs Mosher. called to see me and babies.  Baby Belle Badger is quite ill with fever.  sent again for Dr. Small.  my daughter Belle hurt herself lifting her baby out the crib and note left margin:  baby Harvey Sick  X  is threatened with miscarriage, her baby quite sick with whooping Cough.  Mrs Fitch going in the morning to nurse baby Harvey.  Friday July 9th 1875  It bid fair to be a pretty day, but it is now getting cloudy.  last night I did not undress, but staid up with Mrs Nicholson and Lena nursing the sick baby.  it was very ill all night, with high fever. it is a very ill baby now.  all of my family well.  I went down to see Belle early, and found Mrs Fitch, the lady who Mr Harvey has hired to assist Nursing the baby Harvey who has Whooping Cough.  she is a nice lady.  he pays her fifteen dollars a week.  she will travel with Belle to the Seaside, as Mr Harvey thinks he can't go.  John is still sick with his foot.  Mattie gone to Belle,s to spend the day.  Col Nelson called after tea, Mr Angell and I walked down to see Belle.  found them better.  Saturday July 10th 1875  This has been a beautiful day.  all of us well, the little Angell better, Dr Small came to see her this afternoon, I went to see Belle,s baby. she quite sick with fever and John sick with loose bowels.  they  X  will try and get off for the Seaside on Monday.  note left margin:  dispatch  Ada out shopping for her trip.  we talk of leaving on Monday too.  Mrs & Miss Adams Smith called to day  A dispatch from Louisville says they leave for Saratoga and Cape Cod on Monday.  Sunday July 11th 1875  This has been a lovly day.  all of us well.  I went to church first time since Eva died, felt sad and lonely.  after church went to see Belle, her baby a little better, returned to dinner and then Mr Angell and I went to Graceland to Eva,s grave.  took out beautiful flowers.  her grave and Mary Virginia,s are really little gardens, they are so full of flowers, we went again to Belle,s and stayed to supper -- we leave for the Seaside to morrow.

Monday July 12th 1875  note top right: left for Saratoga   This has been a beautiful day. but warm -- all of us well.  we are busy packing our trunks, Jamie is making purchases for Belle, she starts the same time we do, only in another Car.  X  Ada gone to sit again for Mr Golman.  I have made my little twin Angells very Comfortable, and will leave them with Mrs Nicholson and Lena, Mr Badger, Sheridan and Shreve, all will remain at home.  My Hunt all day sick in bed with fever and pain in his stomach,  we finished our packing and left at half past five O. clock.  had the large Drawing room, my party consisted of Mr Angell, Mattie Faulds, Ada, James, Tom Shreve, Hunt and myself, we said good bye to Mr Badger Sheridan & Shreve and soon we were out of sight.  Mr Angell has been very kind to us, and we are very comfortable.  we spent a very good night,  Ada Mattie Hunt and myself occupied the drawing room.  Belle was in the Car next to us, she has with her Mrs Fitch, Maggie John and her baby.  she also had the drawing room, we kept up a visiting all day.  Hunt had very  X  high fever all night, I think he must have cold.  we went along safe and well all night,  Mary and Emerson Tuttle with their Father are on the train.   Tuesday July 13th 1875.  +  It is a beautiful sunny morning. but quite warm.  all well but Hunt.  he still has high fever, and at breakfast on the Car, after eating blackberries, he had quite a chill. and afterwards fever.  Belle and John Harvey breakfasted with us.  we had for breakfast, blackberries, strawberries, chicken, steak, Omelet fried and stewed potatoes, nice warm rolls Corn bread, Coffee and milk.  I sent a letter to Mr Badger at Buffalo at Suspension bridge Niagara Falls.  Belle and her family take another Car and go direct to Boston.  we remain in our same Car and go to New York.  just now every one has rushed to the doors and windows, as a lady was getting off the Car to get on another train she fell in a fit, and they picked her up and carried her in, it made for a moment quite an excitement.  X  Wednesday July 14th, 1875  I did not sleep well, Hunt had such a high fever all night, he is very sick, we were awakened by the Porter as we had to get off the Cars at seven, there was a large Stage Coach waiting for us, to take us across the ferry, it was a long ride, we went into a Restaurant  X  at the Union depot to get our breakfast, in going across the floor I fell flat down over a little step I did not see, all the children laughed -- I did not hurt myself

Journal of Mrs. A. C. Badger, Chicago Ill.  Sunday Dec 17th 1865.  A beautiful day. but cold. all well. children went to Sabbath School.  four of them. Father Badger dined with us.  So did Alice Hilton.  My husband out to his Mothers.  Monday Dec 18th 1865.  Weather  blank.  all  blank. Hannah finishing the magenta dresses of Belle & Eva. making them new Lionesse cloth.  Making Ada a scarlet satin dress. I have a great deal to do. as I want to go to Louisville on Wednesday. Our old black
cook Rachel lost her baby. Willis of consumption three weeks ago. made last week several calls on the west side. called to see Mother Badger Uncle Isaac and family left for their home in Mississippi on  blank night. I went with Mr Badger to the Depot with them. they have four young children. the baby six weeks old born in Chicago. went last Teusday to a party at Mrs McGinnis on Michigan given to a Mr De Voght. enjoyed myself much Mr Morse and Mr Cogswell called.  Mr Badger & I called to see Mrs Beecher.  Tuesday Dec 19th  Again it is cold. all well. working hard to get all our things finished before we start for Louisville  Wednesday Dec 20th  It is fearful cold. some fear that the snow will prevent travel on the cars. if so we will be very disappointed in not going to Louisville. I shall still finish getting ready. I went down town to day. and took Shreve & Sheridan with me. it blew severely before we returned home. and a severe storm of snow came up. we could scarce see before us the snow was like a cloud it was so fine.  Thursday Dec 21st 1865.  It is still Severely Cold. but clear. I finished packing this morning. and fear we will not get off to night. Mrs Tilton & children. all came to say good bye to us. Mr Badger brought me good news at dinner that we could go to night. so we hurried up. had two carriages. baggage

over.   Thursday Dec 21st 1865.  Took a baggage wagon and went to the Depot. left Pauline our French girl. and Jim to take care of the house.  Octavius & William Gerrish will sleep at my house. I left them both there when we started. all night we travelled along safely in our sleeping Car. and at six we stopped at Cokomo.  Friday Dec 22nd  We all got out of the car. and went into a Hotel kept on the road and took breakfast. here we took a room and stayed untill two O.clock. then took our dinner and got into the Cars again and started for Louisville. our party consisted of Mr Badger. myself. five children. Mattie Faulds. my nurse Ellen and my coloured woman Nancy. we travelled very slowly on account of the snow on the road. arrived at Jeffersonville at twelve O.clock at night. got in the Buss and arrived at Mr Faulds house. found all up waiting for Mrs Faulds to return from Mrs L. L. Shreves party Mrs T T Shreve my sister was also at the party.  they did not expect us. had not received our telegraph all were delighted to see us. went to bed at two in the morning.  Saturday Dec 23rd  It is a lovely day. all well. breakfasted late. Sister Belle came up and brought her children. they are beautiful children. after dinner Sister Belle & I went to the Toy shops and bought a lot of Christmas. came home late. Sister Belle took all our trunks to her house this afternoon.  Sunday Dec 24th  Belle Eva & Ada gone with David my brother in law to Christ Church. all of us went to Brother T T Shreve,s to dinner. they sent the Carriage for us. Mr & Mrs Hunt came to see me.

Monday Dec 25th 1865.  It is a beautiful day. not at all cold. we fixed our Christmas tree so that it looked very handsome, all my girls went to church again with Uncle David.  at one O.clock. all the children of Chas Shreve. David Virginia Mattie & James. Sallie Carter & brother Charles Virginia Barret & little Sister. Miss Ellen Morris. Mrs Morton Morris. Chas Tucker junior. Young Casseday. Mary Clusters Johnson. little Morris. all marched in to see the tree. all were delighted X there were gifts for every one. and some very handsome Mrs Robert Tyler sent my Belle a very handsome sett of Garnet jewelry. we had Egg Nog and Cakes & Candy for the children, at four O.clock we closed our doors, and we all went to my Mothers and had a very fine family Christmas dinner. after ten Ma was quite sick for several hours. at ten O.clock a band of Musicians came to serenade us. they played well. we invited them in and feasted them. they then played many times for us. at twelve we all separated and went home to Brother Shreve,s   Tuesday Dec 26th  Another bright day. all well. Ma better. we have all remained at home this morning. Sarah Nock invited us to dine Wednesday Dec 27th we accepted It is quite cold. all well. Virginia & children came up to see us to day. Mrs Ellen Hewitt called and brought her baby with her. Mrs Gault? & Benedict came to see me.  Lizzie Hunt came to see me. so did Miss Adele Peters. David came to see us after tea so did James Speed.  Thursday Dec 28th  Mrs Cochran & Miss Ellen called. so did Mrs Josh Speed.  Misses Prather. Mrs Danforth Mrs Mary Johnson. Mollie Van Buren wants to give a party to my girls but they did not go. Mrs Jarvis and Miss Baine came to see us. many girls have called to see my children. Mrs Morris & Miss Ellen came to see me so did Mrs Brent

Friday Dec 29th 1865.  We slept all night at Maxs & Mr Badger left us for Chicago at six this morning.  I returned to Sister Belle's after dinner.  Saturday Dec 30th  We are very busy to day getting ready for New Years day. Mattie Belle & Tom we sent up to Ma's at four O.clock. Octavius Badger arrived from Chicago quite well at eight the same evening. Mary Goodloe arrived from Lexington with her young baby and Nurse. the baby is named Belle Sheridan she is Mr Shreve,s daughter Mary.  Sunday Dec. 31st 1865.  It sprinkles rain. We ordered the Carriage and Sister Belle, Octave, Mary Goodloe and my three girls with me all went to Christ Church. after church went to see Ma. all of us. Belle, Eve went with David to afternoon service.  Monday Jan 1st 1866.  We rose early. I sent my two boys up to see their Grandma in a hack. We fixed our tables and dressed ourselves in party cloths darkened the parlour. lit the gas. had a band of seven Musicians. and made a grand display. at twelve twenty young ladies came in party dress and remained all day and entertained with us. Sister had three tables filled with delicious and substantials. the large parlours were filled with visitors. gentleman of all ages. they all joined in the dance with the young ladies. my children were much admired everything passed off delightfully. and all left the house at eight o.clock according to invitation.  Mrs L L Shreve invited our our company over to her house after they left ours. we all went over a little while. except Mr & Mrs T T Shreve. they retired quite tired

Monday. Jan 1st 1866. Over  New Years day - After remaining about an hour. My Sister Mrs T T. Shreve sent for us to come home. as we had a serenade. we came over and found a band of seven playing before the door. we invited them in and treated them to Cake & wine. and they went into the Parlour and played many tunes for us. and we danced in a few minutes all the company at Mrs L. L. Shreve's came over and joined us and we danced untill one o.clock. Mr & Mrs Shreve still in bed. we had a very
grand time. Mrs Scrips of Chicago fell dead to day. while entertaining.  Teusday Jan 2nd 1866.  After breakfast we went into the Library and chatted awhile.  then Mary Goodloe went out and made some calls. News from Chicago state that Cousin Eddie Cutts was thrown from our Buggy and severely hurt on the first of January. he lies with eyes wide open and unconscious.     Wednesday Jan 3rd  Again it is bright but cold. all well but baby Shreve she has cold. Virginia came to see us and brought
her children. Mrs Bishop called and her daughter Mrs Robbins. also Adele Peters. Dr Phelps and his wife also called. Mary Goodloe left for her home at one O.clock to day. my children all out walking. Eddie still unconscious. pulse at forty. he has been several days injured and no sign of returning consciousness yet.  Thursday Jan 4th
Another clear cold day. Mrs A. Hite, Mrs Barret Mrs Eaches. Mrs Wright Mrs Danforth. Mrs Nannie Carter and Miss Robinson. Miss Riddle also called and a Mrs Bartlett.  news from Chicago still unfavourable about Eddie no sign of consciousness for five days. all much distressed about him. he Mother Aunt Lizzie as we call her is old and  almost crazy.  Sheridan sick to night from indigestion. his stomach very delicate. Shreve has cold Adele Shreve has a severe cough.

Wednesday July 14. 1875 / continued  Mr Kelly the Conductor who was on Mrs Harvey,s train, came to us at breakfast and said he saw Belle,s family all safe on the train for Boston.  Hunt is feeling much better, it is very warm and dusty.  we have the drawing room on this Car,  it is not so nice as they are on the Pullman train of yesterday. we will not reach Boston before five this Afternoon.  we are all tired and dusty but well, we have been so long in the Car.  Thursday July 15th 1875  X  Last night we all stayed at the Revere House. and had a nice dinner, and good rooms all on the same floor, all spent a  X  very good night, Hunt had very high fever all night, and I did not sleep well.  the Porter waked us all up at six O. clock. to start for Yarmouth, but Hunt was so sick with pain in his bowels and fever, that I sent to the Office and they sent for Dr Goodby  , he came and gave Hunt Pulsatilla and Nux. and said I would have to be very careful or he would have Typhoid fever.  they hurried us up and at seven I had the Porter carry Hunt and we got in a Stage Coach and started for the Cars.  when we got to the Cars, we found them very crowded, so we put Belle and  X  her family in what seats they could find, and I went into the  X   Baggage Car with my family, and in a little while they succeeded in getting the Smoking Car seats for us all.  the ride was hot and dusty and we reached Yarmouth at one O. clock, got out, found only two Carriages, so we had very close packing.  there were two young ladies who the driver left at Mr Halls.  they were Cousins.  it is six miles from Yarmouth to Cape Cod Bay House.  so we arrived at half past one.  many were on the porch to receive us including Mr Lufkin,  Mrs & Miss Westcott, Miss Lincoln and Dr Hulce.  all were glad to see us, and Eva Pratt was also on the porch.  we have a little dining room to ourselves and Miss Pratt waits on table  after dinner we went up and selected rooms for ourselves.  we took nine rooms, Mr Angell has his room on the third floor. they are very kind. Belle,s baby has the whooping Cough so badly that every one with a baby here are frightened, so she has decided to go to a Cottage kept by the widow Homes.  Maggie the nurse has it too, Mrs Fitch has assists in nursing the baby.  takes care of baby at night, so Belle is much relieved  we have a dining room to ourselves, we find here Mr & Mrs Westcott Miss Westcott Mr Tewksbury, Miss Maud Lincoln, Dr Hulce old Mr Humphrey, Eva Pratt, all who were here last year and many more.

Friday July 16th 1875  This has been a cloudy day, with rain a little  all of us well.  Hunt still sick but better.  Ada in front yard playing Croquet.  Mr Angell Belle and myself all went in a buggy to see the widow Homes cottage.  we were very much pleased, she she has six large rooms she will let my daughter Mrs Harvey have. and give her the full use of everything.  they have a cow and calf for the baby and a nice large yard.  Belle is delighted and will move to night if it dont rain.  it is only a quarter of a mile from the Hotel. and the lady is a very nice woman  Mr Angell will. leave at one O.clock for Boston, to see  X  his Mother.  she lives at Providence  a dispatch from Mr Pullman says the twin Angells are well.  so Mr Angell started.  it has rained hard all afternoon, so Belle wont move.  Hunt took a chill to night, and had all evening severe headache, I bathed his feet and head in hot water and sent for Dr Hulce who occupied the room next to me.  he gave Hunt some of his number four and Hunt in a little while vomited and its relieved his head, I did not sleep well.  Saturday July 17th 1875  X  This has been a splendid day.  the rain of last night has made it perfect.  all of us well, Hunt much better this morning.  Belle got everything ready and at twelve O.clock Mr Lufkin got out his Omnibus, and took her family Bag and Baggage?.  I went down in the wagon this afternoon and found her very happy. and delighted with everything.  they are in such comfort.  we watched all day for Mr Faulds family to arrive, but they did not come  To night a dispatch came from Saratoga saying that Adele Shreve was sick and that they would not leave Saratoga at present.  so after Tea Mattie Faulds James & Ada  X  walked to Belle,s and showed her the message.  I received a nice letter from Mr Badger, Sheridan and a beautiful note from Mrs Locke,s mother, with a peice  X of poetry. about Eva, it was beautiful

Sunday July 18th 1875  It commenced bright and sunny.  all of us well.  I rose early so did Hunt, went down stairs and found it was the bell to wake the people and breakfast would not be ready for a half hour, so we went out on the porch in the sun and soon breakfast was ready.  It began to cloud over and at eleven it looked like rain, but we all went to church in Mr Lufkins Omnibus, it was a pretty white Church and a good size Congregation, also a good Choir the minister was very good,  we stopped at the Cottage and took Belle and John to church with us.  we then came to dinner, and I wrote to Chicago.  at three O. clock I walked down to see Belle with Tom, and stopped about two hours.  then Mr Lufkin sent a Carriage for me.  so I came home to tea,  It now rains very fast. and everything seems so gloomy and sad.  I grow very tired of things that once pleased me so much.  X  Eva,s death has been a great Calamity to a great many and it has taken twenty years from me. indeed even more  Monday July 19th 1875  This has been a glorious day. after the rain of last night we are all well, Hunt is himself once more.  our party at the Hotel could not go this morning fishing, as the surf was too much, about twenty boarders including my family and Faulds all walked over to the observatory  after dinner I walked to Belle,s cottage with Dr Hulce stayed about two hours and returned,  they all well but baby coughs badly.  Belle called in her Carriage that she has hired to take me to drive, a large party from Brewster came here to night to get supper and Cream  I sent our Buggy for Belle and she came over and stayed untill ten O. clock and I sent her back in the Buggy and gave her Ice cream.  received many letters and papers  Tuesday July 20th 1875  I never saw a more lovely day than this, all our party and Tom went out in a large Sail boat fishing with Mr Weskott, Mr Tewksbury, Mr Nelson, Captain Smalley and Mr.  blank Hunt and I went to the Beach to see them off.  Mattie and James are going to the Village of Denniss with Belle.  Belle came to dine with us and I walked home with her, she sent for Dr Hulce to see John,s foot, I walked home with him, to night they are dancing in the parlour.  we do not take part in anything.

Wednesday strikeout:  Tuesday July 21st 1875  This has been a lovely bright day -- all of us well  Hunt has grown strong, and has no fever.  note left margin:  Angell Boston X  Mattie Hunt and I went to Belle,s Cottage and spent the morning.  we went down in the Buggy with Mr Lufkin and returned on a grocery wagon.  they all well at the Cottage  at noon the stage came up with Mr Angell from Boston.  Belle came up from her Cottage with him, and stayed a few minutes and returned with the stage again. note left margin:  Saratoga  Mr Angell says my Sister want all their children and myself to come to Saratoga, as they have taken a Cottage for the summer.  so we sent for Belle to come to supper and we will talk with her and persuade her to go with us.  Mattie Faulds has sick headach.  a large party came up for cream.  Thursday July 22st  X  This has been a sultry day.  all of us well.  I went to the Beach with Hunt, a fishing party went out this morning, I went with Mr Angell at ten O. clock to the telegraph Office, we brought home Mr Lufkins new note left margin:  John Boston foot  Carryall behind our buggy.  I stopped at Belle,s and took dinner.  Mr Fitch and John went up to Boston this morning to show the doctor his foot  it is very bad from the old cut.  I stayed all day with Belle.  Mattie  Mattie has gone to sleep all night with Belle,  Ada and Mr Angell went out note left margin:  swim  to swim and bathe,  letters from home say the babies are sick from changing milk,  Friday July 23rd  It is raining this morning, and has been all night,  Hunt was sick all night with pain in his stomach, and about three O. clock I went to Mrs Pratts room and asked her for some whisky, she got up and went to her Mothers room in her undress and brought me Ginger and whisky, and this morning Hunt has diahhorea  X  all the rest well, Mattie stayed all night with Belle.  and has not yet returned.  Mr Angell and I are both very gloomy here.  I am going to see Belle when the boy goes after the mail, I made a short visit and Miss Lincoln and brother came after me.  after lunch Mr Angell Mattie & Ada took Belle and all went to East Denniss to telegraph.  had a letter and dispatch from Mr Badger

Saturday July 24th 1875.  John Harvey and Mr Fitch arrived from Boston at eight O.clock last night, both well, a Surgeon saw the foot  X  and said it was serious and needed prompt attention and that he must return to Boston on Monday.  I went after breakfast to see Belle, found them all well.  returned to the Hotel at eleven, Ada Mr Angell Maud and others went bathing and swimming. and enjoyed it.  John Harvey came to dinner with us.  received a letter from Mr Badger, and one for Hunt.  after one O. clock dinner Mr Angell took Mattie Hunt and myself to drive, we called and took Belle with us.  had a pleasant ride, took Dr. Hulce.  about four O. clock Mr Angell Ada James and Tom went to row.  and enjoyed it.  Belle came down in her Carriage at five, and we all went on the Beach and sat in the sand, and baby Harvey was delighted.  then Belle returned to the house and took supper with us, and Mr Angell and I walked home with her, and Mr Lufkin sent the Buggy for us.  Hunt went in the parlour and played note left margin:  Pullman babies  in the games with the family or boarders I mean.  a dispatch from Chicago say the babies are not well.  Mrs Pullman and twins left for New York and Long branch on the 20th she has gained strength very slowly.  vertical note left margin: Belle took supper with us -- and Mr Angell took her home in the Buggy we are trying to persuade her to go to Saratoga  Sunday July 25th 1875  This is a most beautiful day.  all of us well, after breakfast we took the Carriage and went to the Cottage to see Belle, found her and baby well, she had a dispatch from Mr Harvey, he says John must go to Boston and see Dr Bigelow about his foot. he did not know that Belle had sent him a few days ago there to see Dr Snow a surgeon.  and John has to go again to morrow to Boston to see the doctor with Mr Fitch. the unclear.  Mattie Mr Angell and myself stayed with Belle, untill James came to take her to church.  we walked home.  Ada and Hunt are on the beach picking shells.  Oh' how sad it is to me to think that I will never see my queenly and Christ like child again, Oh' it is so hard to bear, she filled so large a part in my heart, I have lost ten years of my life although I have left so many beautiful worthy loving children and so good a husband, and so much of this worlds goods and wealth, yet I do so keenly feel the abscense of my lost one. I mourn for her day and night, her babies cannot make up the loss -- they rather increase my grief -- when I look at the poor little Innocents.

Monday July 26th 1875  This has been a beautiful day, all was well and went to breakfast, after breakfast Mr Angell drove me to Belle,s Cottage and Mattie Faulds went also. John and Mr Fitch gone to Boston to see Dr Snow about his foot. Belle has note left margin: Cape Cod Bay House  decided not to go with us to Saratoga, but will remain as the Cape with her nurses Mr Fitch and Maggie, I spent the morning with her and then she went up to the Hotel with us to dinner, poor child she wants so much to go with us, but she thinks her baby,s whooping better here, after our dinner Mr Lufkin has his Omnibus  X  ready and all the boarders came out to see us off. Mrs Westcott & Miss Westcott, Mr Tewksbury & Miss White, also Maud. We left after saying good Bye to all at three O. clock, and travelled until six O.clock when we reached Boston and took a stage Coach to the Revere House. there we had a good supper, and went to our room and washed then at nine O. clock took the train for Saratoga, and travelled all night safe and sound, our party consisted of Mr Angell Miss Mattie Faulds & James Faulds. Tom Shreve Ada, Hunt & myself, all at the Cape felt sorry to part with us. my poor daughter, Mrs Harvey I have to leave behind, as she thought it best to remain with her sick children a little longer.  Tuesday July 27, 1875  This morning at six O. clock we reached Albany, there we took breakfast at the Depot, then took Cars to Saratoga and reached there at nine O. clock found at the depot Mr Faulds Mr Shreve, Mattie Belle & Adele, they took us up to their Cottage in a Carriage, and found Virginia there all bright and well, and nicely fixed, and they have note left margin: Angill New York  fixed rooms for us all in the same house, and Mr Angell has a nice room in a house two doors from us, and we all eat at the Cottage kept by Mr L Sak  I wrote to Belle to day. all of us well.  Wednesday July 28th 1875  It rained last night, but this morning is all sunshine Hunt spent a bad night, he ate ginger cake for supper and it gave him pain, and he vomited and had his bowels disturbed but this morning he is all right again. Mr Angell took breakfast with us and he and all the family have gone to the springs Mr blank Woolley had called to see Virginia and Siss to day. Ada and James gone to Stewarts dry goods store, I wrote home to day and will also write to Dr. Hulse at Cape Cod. Mr Angell gone to night to New York - after supper we took a walk

Thursday July 29th 1875  It looks this morning like rain, all seem well with us, and all are going out to walk to the spring  X  and after lunch we walked to the Park, which is a block from our Cottage, the name of the Gentleman who owns the house is Croffs, we are all well, after dinner we all went to walk.  met on the street Mrs Lucius Sherman, Mrs H. O. Stone is here, so is Mr W. W. Kimball Mr Ballard and I wrote to Mr Badger, my Father, Dr Craik, Mrs Donthill and will write to Mrs Leiter  X  to morrow.  Friday July 30th 1875  It rained a little last night, but this morning is beautiful, I rose early and David. James, Hunt and I all went to the Hawthorn spring and drank the water, then to the Congress spring and took  X  a little.  Hunt had the Dog named Joe with him, he is a beautiful Spitz,s dog.  she is a pretty little girl who lives in the Cottage near us, and plays with our children.   I wrote a long letter to day to Mrs Leiter in England.  I have just received a letter from Mr Angell, he will be here in the morning.  I also had a letter from Mr Badger  X  and Shreve, the twins are doing well.  Saturday July 31st  This is a beautiful day.  all of us in health.  I have a stiff neck from taking a sponge bath last night.  all are up early going to the Depot to meet Mr Angell from New York.  I walked down with Hunt but he did not come, so we all drank Washington water and returned to breakfast and then walked in the Park.  at lunch Mr Angell walked in, he had missed connections.  he is well and fat, but very depressed, after supper all walked out and   X  drank Congress water and Columbia water.  Sunday Aug, 1st 1875  This has been a beautiful day.  all of us well, after breakfast all of us including Mr Angell went to church, it was crowded with people. and we had very good preaching.  we all went to the Hawthorn spring and returned to dinner, after dinner sat awhile at the door and then walked to the Graveyard and saw the grave of Gertie Croffs -- then to the Park, after supper I took a long walk with Mr Angell.  he very blue --

Monday Aug 2nd 1875  X  It has looked all day like rain, but it has not, all of us well, at eight O. clock we all went to the Spring and drank iron water, Hunt included, then we returned to breakfast.  after breakfast sat at the door, my Sisters families all well,  Mr Angell  X  very blue to day, and is quite unnerved, after dinner the children all went to hear the music and to see the learned Pig, who is quite a curiosity, then David Siss Ada and myself all went to drive to the spouting and Geyser spring which is a beautiful spot, we then drove through the town which is beautiful, to our surprise when we got home X  Dr Thoms sat at our front door, he has travelled after us for month, he is in love with Siss.  he is going to stay here awhile.  after ten we all went walking I had a letter from Dr Hulce at Cape Cod.  I am going back to Chicago in a few days with Mr Angell.  I had a letter from Mr Badger, he says the babies are not well,  Tuesday Aug 3rd 1875  I rose this morning at seven, found it raining.  it has been all night, after breakfast all of us went to the spring and drank Congress water.  then returned home and did some mending, had a talk with Dr Simms about my darling  X  Eva, as well as I could describe her case, he says she evidently died of Embolus, or heart trouble from the terrible schock to her tender system,  we are unnerved.  still, I find it quite hard to control my feelings.    after tea all went again to the spring, but I staid and talked with Dr Thoms about the trouble nearest my heart and his idea of the case is that there was not the right contraction   X  and that she had Albumen in her blood.  Oh if I could feel that all was right.  Mr Faulds went to New York tonight  Wednesday Aug 4th 1875   It rained all night and also this morning, but we all went to drink Congress, and Columbia water  I wrote to Mrs Chas Johnson,  we received letters from Belle and from Mr Badger, they all well, and the little Angells quite well.   Mr Harvey is to arrive at Cape Cod to day.  we made Mr Angell leave his house and come and stay here last night, as David was in New York.  it has rained a great deal to day.

Thursday Aug 5th 1875  Ths sun rose bright this morning -- but very wet under feet, all of us well, we all went to the spring and took note left margin: Faulds New York  our water, while at breakfast Mr Faulds returned to our Cottage from New York and brought Adele a Parrot Cape  we that is Mr Angell Hunt and myself intend to return to Chicago to night, and leave Ada here with my Sisters.  Dr Thoms came up to say good bye.  in the Afternoon David Mrs Shreve Mr Angell and myself all went to Moons Lake, which is a pretty spot, Frank Leslie has beautiful grounds and beautiful stables and one of the most beautiful gardens, a lovely spot.  we came home at six and met all the gay people driving on the road to Moons Lake.  at nine O. clock an Omnibus called for us, and David James & Mattie Faulds Mattie Belle Tom and Adele all went to the Cars with us,  Mrs Shreve took a severe headache and could not go with us.  we had nice accommodations on the Cars, , all slept well, and this morning at nine we reached Rochester, and had our breakfast at Congress Hall, and then our dinner on the Hotel Car in our drawing room, and also our tea  Friday Aug 6. 1875  We rested well last night and to day have been on the Car, taking our meals, it is not very warm  at London we got out and walked on the platform and I had a drawing room, so did Mr Angell have one,  we spent a good night and hope to reach Chicago in the morning, Mr Harvey and George and Rob are at Cape Cod  X  Saturday Aug 7th 1875  I rose early this morning, the sun shone brightly note left margin: arrived home Aug 7   all of us well, at half past eight we reached Chicago and met at the Depot Mr Badger Sheridan & Shreve and Octave, all were glad to see us, we walked up to our house and found a very fine breakfast waiting for us  the babies are much improved and look very pretty, Hunt note left margin: whiskers  delighted to get home, Mr Badger has shaved off his whiskers and looks like a fright.  I only knew him  X  by his clothes.  it has so changed his looks.

Sunday Aug 8th 1875  This is a beautiful day.  all of us well, I went to church with Mr Angell, then returned to dinner and after dinner Mr Angell and I went out to the Cemetery and took a beautiful Boquet out to Eve, and I put some on Mary Virginia,s bed.  we then returned home, I had the babies out to ride and then to walk.  Monday Aug 9th 1875  This has been a very warm day.  all of us well.  I put the babies in seperate rooms, and they slept so much better  then I sent them out to get the air, and it seemed to do them good.  Mrs Hilton called to see me to day so did Dr Locke,  I went out to get the air about five O,clock with Mr Badger Shreve and Hunt, we rode on the Boulevard, Oh if Eva was only here to go with us how happy I should feel, but now I cannot enjoy or smile at anything.  I wrote  X  home to Pa and Ma to day.  Ada wrote me from Saratoga.  they all well.  Ellen Scanlon came to see us about her Husband, he has got himself in trouble by drinking, and he is now discharged from duty as a Policeman, Mr Angell out riding, he went to Hyde Park,  Tuesday Aug 10, 1875  It has been raining all day and still continues to night. we are all well,  but have not gone out to night note left margin: Mrs  X  Nicholson  the babies are growing nicely.  Mr Badger and Shreve gone down street in the buggy,     Mrs Nicholson grew very angry with me to about the cow, she insists we ought to have kept the Dunne Cow after it had been sent away, but at the time she did not think  X  it so important  note left margin: X  Harvey arrived  Wednesday Aug 11th 1875  This has been a lovely day, all of us well, after breakfast Mr Angell discharged Mrs Nicholson, as she became fretful and sick, Mrs Nelson called to see the babies, Belle with her husband and all her family came from Cape Cod this morning, all well and fat.  Mr Badger and Shreve out Nurse hunting. I sent for Dr Small to see the babies as they did not seem well in their bowels, Miss Markley sent me some wedding Cake

Thursday Aug 12, 1875  It has been a good day, all of us well but Hunt  he has cold and fever and pain in his stomach. Mr Small came to see the babies, and gave them medicine,  Belle came up to see us all, to night Mr Angell has gone out, I staid all night with the children, they did not sleep much, I mean the babies, Mrs Henry King called so did Mrs George Otis, she saw the babies and thought them splendid,  Friday Aug 13th 1875  This has been another lovely day.  all of us well.  I sent the little Angells out twice to day.  to get the air  since I have taken the care of them, Nancy has helped  a letter from Saratoga say they all are well,  the babies are splendid, and are getting very fat  Mrs & Miss Wheelock came to see me to day.  Saturday Aug 14th 1875  This has been a very warm day.  all of us well [[note left margin: Miss Adams strikeout: Miss Davis Nurse, ]]  I sent the babies out for the fresh air, to day Miss Davis has come to us reccommended by all the Lunts to assist in taking care of the Little Angells, she is very handy, but very deaf.  children still cry a great deal at night but they grow fat and strong,  I had a letter from Ada and one from James.  Sunday Aug 15 1875  It rained early this morning, but cleared off and Mr Angell. and I went to church together  after church we went to Belle,s house, but she was out, our babies feel very well to day.  they sleep and eat well.  Belle & Mr Harvey came up and dined with us, Belle feeling quite well, her children getting over the whooping cough.  after dinner Mr Angell and I went out to Graceland together, the graves are looking very beautiful, my two dear children lie very near each other, my beautiful Eva and my beautiful Mary Virginia, both of them such christlike children

[[note top center:  Annie Frank 41 Grove near Larrabee? and Webster street]]  Monday Aug 16, 1875  This has been a changable day.  sunshine and clouds  my boys Sheridan & Shreve went out to Calumet to shoot ducks -- they had a good time but got nothing  Hunt went out in the Buggy with Mr Badger  the oldest baby Ada Badger has much improved in health and sleeps and eats well.  but little baby to day is sick in her bowels and has cold, all our family well, I had a letter from Mrs TT. Shreve.  Hunt Breckinridge called at our house while I was at Saratoga to see the babies -- after tea Mr Angell and I went to see Belle, she just returned from Sandwich, it being the anniversary of old Mr Harvey,s birthday.  he 70 years old.  Miss Adams is doing very well with our babies --  Tuesday Aug 17, 1875  It has been cool and clear all day.  all of us well,  the babies have had a good day and we quite well  we have commenced to feed them on Grannum? -- our cow,s milk does not agree with them, I went this afternoon out to drive with Mr Badger and Hunt.  called to see Belle before going home, Octave has the Chin Cough, so he thinks, Sheridan went out to Riverside and spent the day.  shooting at ducks  he bought a little pointer dog, home with him he paid five dollars for it --  Wednesday Aug 18, 1875  This has been a beautiful bright sunny day.  all of us well, babies improve very fast and grow fat, and smile sweetly.  they know me well -- I drove out to day with Hunt and Sheridan -- went to see Belle, found all well  she and Mr Harvey came up to tea -- letters from Saratoga  say they will stay untill the first of September.  I received a letter from Hetty Bond Nason of sympathy and one from Mrs Ogden and one from Miss Lucy Cowan also one from Mattie Sheridan.

Thursday Aug 19th 1875.  This has been a lovely day.  all of us well, the babies have been splendid all the day.  the Grannum has agreeded with them first rate, and they feel now very happy -- I took them out in my Carriage to drive.  Mrs Fleetwood called to see me, and the babies  so did Ella Badger and Mrs Hilton, Horace was here also -- I went to the Office for Mr Angell and he and I went out riding on the Boulevard  Mr Badger went in the Pheaton with Shreve and Hunt to hear the Music on the Boulevard  I received a letter from Saratoga from Ada  all well and fat --, Weather quite cool here in Saratoga is is quite warm --  Friday Aug 20th 1875  It is beautiful to day.  all of us well, I remained at home during the morning, and after dinner I went out to drive, Belle came to see me in the morning and I went to see her in the afternoon, I sent the babies out to walk, we received letters from Saratoga one from Ada she is well, Octave received a picture from Saratoga of the house we lived in during our stay there -- they all well.  Mr Angell went to Evanston with Mr Lunt. to see Catie  Mr James Morton,s wife had a daughter to day.  all well, Mr Harvey Belle and John came up and spent the Afternoon  Saturday Aug 21, 1875  It is quite cold, all of us well.  babies very well -- Sheridan I forgot has cold with fever -- and did not go to Pullmans Office to work, I went driving and took Mr Angell and Hunt with me.  Thomas our driver drove us so close the track, we all jumped out -- and no harm was done. Mr A. D. Hunt arrived to day and left to night.
